She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is 45 years old. She is married and she has 6 children aged between 9 and 20. She also takes care of a 65-year-old person. She has been running a small shop since 2000. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 10 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zahra now hopes for a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is 24 years old and is married. She has sold perfume and clothes since 2007. She works every day from 10 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.
 
Ilham now hopes for a loan to buy more perfume and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more perfume and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zouloholou

texts.fr: M. Zouloholou, célibataire sans enfant est née le 30/05/1984 à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse et n’a plus une autre activité rémunératrice de revenu. Elle sollicite un appui financier pour s’équiper en matériel et en produits cosmétiques   pour développer son salon de coiffure afin d’exercer convenablement son activité.
texts.en:
Zouloholou M. is single without children and was born in Lomé on May 30th, 1984. She is a hairdresser and does not have another source of income. She is requesting financial support to buy equipment and cosmetic products to improve her hair salon so that she can run her business well.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work equipment and cosmetic products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. A. is divorced and has 6 children. She has never received schooling. Ama sells kenkey, which she prepares with corn. It is one of the most eaten foods in Ghana; she has done this business over 20 years. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of corn for the production of the kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a family house.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of corn for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Beth's Imani Group

texts.en:
Beth is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children, between 12 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Beth is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothing & shoes sales, decorations sales, and handbag sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Adokaume

texts.fr: Née  le 30/12/1979 à Pénaré, S. Adokaume est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est vendeuse de petits beignets et de petits gâteaux. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à faire décoller ses ventes fautes de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour consolider son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Son crédit lui servira à l’achat de la farine de blé et d’huile.
texts.en:
Born on December 30, 1979 in Pénaré, Adokaume S. is single and has no children. She sells donuts and little cakes. In spite of her good will, she can't manage to make her sales take off, because she lacks business capital. She is asking for this loan so that she can consolidate her business and raise her turnover. Her loan will be used to purchase flour and oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding sale of donuts and cakes

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida K. has been selling used clothing and soft drinks at Siwdo since 2007. Vida has received a primary education. She is married and has 3 children; her husband is an accounts clerk. She is responsible for paying for her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing and soft drinks for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to renovate her store.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Judis

texts.en:
Judis is 22 years old and is single. She has owned and run her own clothes shop since 2005. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Judis now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: L. Brigitte est célibataire sans enfant et est née le 24/07/1985 au Ghana. Elle n’a plus d’autre activité à part son salon de coiffure. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat des produits cosmétiques  servant au traitement des cheveux et développer son activité.
texts.en:
Brigitte L. is single with no children and was born on July 24, 1985 in Ghana. Her only business is her beauty salon. She is requesting this loan to purchase cosmetics used for hair treatment. She wants to grow her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cosmetic products for hair

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the last 30 years.  She is the mother of two sons.  Her elder son is a tailor.  The next eldest son sells Punjabi food named "Biryani".  Her husband is a milk seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years.  Sugran baji has a stove where he makes bread on order.  Sugran baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  She bought buffalo from the two loans.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Safia baji and Zuhra baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.  Fozia baji wants a loan to expand her sweetmeat business.  Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goat, cow) for her meat business.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, S. Essenam est née le  11/08/1979 à Ahépé. Son mari est chauffeur sans emploi durable et contribue par moment au besoin du foyer.  Ainsi la majorité des dépenses reviennent à la femme. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat  des produits cosmétique pour développer son activité car malgré sa bonne volonté et son talent elle est limitée par les moyens financiers dans son activité.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of 4 children, S. Essenam was born on 11/08/1979 in Ahépé. Her husband is a driver without long-term employment and he only occasionally contributes to the household needs. Thus the majority of the expenses fall back to the wife. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase cosmetic products to build her business, because despite her good will and talent, she is limited in her activities by a lack of financial means.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sabra's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Sabra is 46 years old. She is married and she has 5 children aged between 10 and 27 years old. She has been selling food, decorations and juice since 2003. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Sabra now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and decoration items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Salma, who has a business dealing with charcoal and bread sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and decoration items for her business.

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: M. Idrissou  est né le 10/04/1974 à Bafilo. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Dans le souci de s’affranchir des détaillants chez qui il s’approvisionne, il sollicite ce crédit pour devenir grossiste lui-même pour réduire ses dépenses et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Son crédit lui servira à passer de grosses commandes des produits divers. Il a une solide expérience en matière de commerce.
texts.en:
M. Idrissou was born on 10/04/1974 in Bafilo. He is single and has no children. Concerned about freeing himself from retailers from whom he gets supplies, he requests this loan so that he can himself become a wholesaler in order to reduce his expenses and increase his profit margin. He will use this loan to place large orders of various products. He has solid experience in trade matters.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Zikran's Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of N. M. and lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the last 40 years.  She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters.  Her elder son is a washer man.  The next eldest son runs a grocery shop.  Her elder daughter sews clothes.  The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  Her husband is a wholesaler.  

Zikran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Rashidan baji wants a  loan to buy mason tools.  Farhat baji wants a loan to buy materials (iron rods) for her welding business.  Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  Latifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Q. is married and has 3 children. She has received primary education schooling. Mercy makes tea and hot chocolate for sale and also sells clothing and fabric at Siwdo, which she has done since 1988. Mercy uses her income to pay for fees to educate her children. Mercy will use the loan to purchase more fabric for sale. Mercy plans to reinvest the new profits from her expansion, and also use part of the profits to buy building materials for their house.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric for sale and ingredients for tea and hot chocolate.

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Née le 30/08/1981 au Burkina Faso, D. Rafiatou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Son mari est comptable. Pour développer son commerce, elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire l’achat des produits divers qui doivent servir à alimenter son commerce afin d’agrandir son étalage. Son expérience est un atout pour rentabiliser ses activités et dégager des revenus
texts.en:
Born on August 30th, 1981 in Burkina Faso, D. Rafiatou is married and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is an accountant. To build her business, she is requesting this loan so that she can purchase various products that should serve to supply her business in order to grow her display. Her experience is an asset that can make her activities profitable and generate income.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and she has 9 children aged between 20 and 33. She has been a clothes (khanga) and spices seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 9:30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Mwanakombo now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) and spices for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and spices

loans.name: Ghulam Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Zainab baji is the wife of M. Iqbal and the mother of one son.  She lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years.  Her husband sells ice-cream.  Her son's name is Muhammad Bota and is 22 years old.  Muhammad Bota has a shoe shop.  He buys shoes from different markets and sells them in his shop.  Ghulam Zainab baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan for her son's shoe business because he is currently out of stock.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Mumtaz baji and Ruqaiya baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell.  Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Sonate

texts.fr: Née le 04/06/1984 à Lomé, K.  Sonate  est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est couturière et à plusieurs apprenties. Dans ses efforts pour agrandir son atelier, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel et en outils de travail afin de d’optimiser la productivité de son atelier.
texts.en:
Born 6/4/84 in Lomé, Sonate K. is single with no children. She is a seamstress and has several apprentices. In her efforts to grow her dress shop, she is seeking this loan to equip herself with equipment and tools in order to optimize the productivity of her shop.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy work equipment and tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maqboola's Group

texts.en:
Maqboola baji is the wife of Q. A. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the last 20 years.  She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son.  Her son is involved in a scrap business.  Her daughter is in 8th standard.  Maqboola baji's husband is a daily wage laborer.  Maqboola baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, papers) to expand her son's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).  Humaira baji and Rafiqan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.  Parveen baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys B. is a single parent and has 4 children. She has received schooling through primary level. Gladys sells used clothing and fabric at Siwdo, which she has done since 1981. Gladys uses her income to take care of her children's welfare. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more used clothing and fabric for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to buy building materials for the family house which is a work in progress.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and fabric for sale

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 47 years old. She is married with 6 children between 30 and 15 years old. She has been a handbags and juice seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more handbags and juice for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more handbags and juice for re-sale

loans.name: Afi Dogbéda

texts.fr: G. Afi Dogbéda est née le 13/09/1974 à lomé. Elles est mariée et a un enfant. Son mari est topographe. C’est une commerçante expérimentée dans la vente du poisson fumé et frisé. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour accroître ses achats de marchandises et augmenter ainsi ses revenus.
texts.en:
Afi Dogbéda G. was born on September 13, 1974 in Lomé. She is married and has one child. Her husband is topographer. She is an experienced seller of smoked and fried fish. She is requesting this loan so as to be able to purchase more goods to sell and thus expand her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is the wife of M. Rafiq and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years.  She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters.  Two of her sons are loaders by profession.  The next eldest to them sells sewing machine parts.  Her younger son is in kindergarten.  Her elder daughter is in 8th standard.  The younger one to her is in 5th standard.  Manzooran baji's husband has a tea stall where he makes tea for the customers.  He has been in this profession for the last 5 years.  Manzooran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her children.  She is applying for a loan to buy materials (tea, sugar) because her husband is out of stock now.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.  Farida baji wants a loan to buy religious books to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for tea stall

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 40 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 22. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 56. She has owned a small food shop since 2000. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Farida now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, salt, and sugar for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Alpha Essohanam

texts.fr: Née le 04/06/1984 à Lomé, K. Alpha Essohanam est une femme mariée sans enfant. Elle est couturière et à plusieurs apprenties. Malgré tous ses efforts, elle  est toujours limitée par le manque de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel et en outils de travail afin de d’optimiser la productivité de son atelier et  agrandir ainsi son atelier
texts.en:
Born on June 4, 1984 in Lomé, Alpha Essohanam K. is a married woman with no children. She is a seamstress and has several young women apprentices. Despite her best efforts, she is always limited by a lack of financial means. She is requesting this loan to outfit herself in materials and the tools of her trade, so as to optimize the productivity of her workshop and to be able to enlarge the workshop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials and tools of her trade

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children between 8 and 3 years old. She owns a small shop and she has been a charcoal seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and other items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and other items for her shop

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 23 years old. She is married with one child aged 1 year old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Gastin Yadema

texts.fr: Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, monsieur Gastin Yadema B.  est né en Novembre 1983 à Lomé. Sa femme est une ménagère à la maison. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Malgré ses efforts il n’arrive pas à sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir un local pour en faire une boutique d’alimentation générale. Actuellement il travaille dans le cafétéria. Ce crédit lui permettra de disposer de ses propres outils de travail.
texts.en:
A married father of two, Mr. Gastin Yadema B. was born in November 1983 in Lomé. His wife is a housewife, so he alone is responsible for the family expenses. Despite his efforts, he is unable to get out of the vicious circle of poverty. He is seeking this loan to get a place to set up a general food store. He currently works in a cafeteria. This loan will allow him to have his own work tools.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a general food store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is 24 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 4. She has been selling food (chapati, cakes and juice) since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 2 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Tausi is now requesting a loan to buy more food inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food materials for her business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née le 04 Novembre 1976, Yawa A.  est une femme mariée. Elle vit avec son mari qui travaille dans l’assurance. Ils ont 3 enfants. Elle fait le commerce des pagnes depuis sa jeunesse, commerce auquel elle associe la préparation et  le vente de riz. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à faire décoller ses ventes comme elle le désire. Elle désire abandonner son métier de restauration  pour se consacrer exclusivement à la vente de pagnes et sollicite un prêt pour passer  des commandes de pagne. Ce qui lui permettra de faire des économies et satisfaire un grand nombre de clients et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born November 4, 1976, Yawa A. is a married woman. She lives with her husband who works in insurance. They have 3 children. She has been selling pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds) since she was young, which she does along with preparing and selling rice. Despite her goodwill, she isn’t able to make her business take off as she would like. She wants to abandon her food-serving business in order to focus exclusively on selling pagnes and is seeking a loan to place an order for pagnes. This would allow her to save and satisfy a large number of clients and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell pagnes (traditional wrap-arounds)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 30 years old. She is single and she takes care of 1 person who is 56 years old. She has been selling shoes and bedsheets since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4:30 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes and bedsheets for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr: Née le en Septembre 1978, Grâce K. est une femme mariée qui a cinq (05) personnes à charges dont deux sont ces propres enfants et vit avec son mari plombier. Elle est restauratrice dans une école primaire de la place. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour  améliorer son activité et se lancer dans le commerce du maïs et riz. Elle désire rembourser son crédit sur une période de douze (12) mois.
texts.en:
Born in September 1978, Grâce K. is a married woman with five (5) people in her care, of whom two are her own children. She lives with her husband, a plumber. She runs a canteen in a local primary school. She is asking for this loan to improve her business and begin selling maize and rice. She intends to repay this loan over a period of twelve (12) months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run a restaurant and sell cereals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children between the ages of 20 and 5. She also takes care of one other person who is 55 years old. She has sold clothes since 2000. She works every day from 8 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Marié sans enfant pour le moment, monsieur Kodzo N.  est né le 13 Avril 1981 à Tsévié. Il a deus (02) personnes à charge. Sa femme est une ménagère à la maison. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Actuellement il est meniez à la solde d’une dame. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir une moto pour en faire un taxi moto. Ce crédit lui permettra de sortir sa famille de la misère et faire face à ses besoins primaires.
 Ce crédit sera remboursé mensuellement sur une période de douze  (12) mois.
texts.en:
Married with no children as of yet, Mr. Kodzo N. was born on 13 April 1981 in Tsévié. He has two (02) people in his care. His wife is a homemaker. Thus, he has to meet his family's expenses by himself. Currently, he works as a miller for hire. He is asking for this loan to acquire a motorcycle to use as a moto-taxi. This loan will allow him to bring his family out of misery and meet his primary needs. This loan will be reimbursed monthly over a period of twelve (12) months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a small entrepreneur from Uzhgorod where she sells women's clothing items in one of the local markets. Nina used to work as a hired employee in a company. However, she couldn't support herself after her retirement and had to find another source of income. This is how she started her own vending venture. Today her business has grown a lot. It has been characterized by affordable prices and consistent expansion within the past 5 years. Nina is constantly working on further business expansion.

Nina is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise and her sales as a result. On the individual level she is hoping to do some repair work in her house which has been a need for her family for awhile. Nina is a very skilled entrepreneur. She can easily adjust to all seasonal trends which helps her meet clients' demands and satisfy different customers' tastes.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married and lives with her husband Vasyl. All of her children are grown. Due to increasing inflation after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Mariya was forced to find ways to sustain herself and she wanted to help her family. That is how she started as a market vendor selling women's clothing in the central market of Uzhgorod. Mariya has been running a kiosk selling this type of merchandise for 7 years already. 

Mariya is always very affable and polite with her customers. Her good managerial skills help her to keep expenses to a minimum. The market where Mariya works is the only one in the neighborhood and there are few other entrepreneurs offering the same type of goods. This is another reason for Mariya's high sales and the success of her trade. Mariya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase her inventory. She is planning to re-stock her kiosk with clothing items to boost her sales. Being a good steward of the money she receives, Mariya will manage this loan efficiently and repay it on time. Hopefully, one day she'll be able to fulfill her dream and open her own little store of clothing items. 

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is a married father of a beautiful little daughter who is only 4. His family lives in Kamenka where Alexei runs a small grocery store selling food products downtown in his home town. Alexei's store is well known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with their work. Alexei has been in this business for 5 years. He has about $10,000 invested in inventory. His net profit is about $600-800 a month.

Alexei is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to purchase a vehicle which would facilitate his business operations and help him travel to buy additional merchandise from wholesalers. Moreover, Alexei is hoping to spend a portion of the loan to buy insulation materials for his store to prepare it for the upcoming cold season. Alexei has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable. However, he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to facilitate his business operations

loans.name: Santos Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Santos Pedro, age 48, is married and is a craft weaver who creates traditional fabric for women. He has a workshop with two looms and employs one weaver. He lives together with his six children and wife. Since his childhood he has worked on as a craftsman and through loans has been able to help his family succeed and become a well known person who resides in the Aldea Vásquez of the municipality and department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has asked the ASDIR association for a loan to purchase raw materials and generate more jobs in his community, doing so will help young people who need work and will also generate income for their own families. With his loan he will be able to meet the demand of his customers and improve his family's living conditions, and will also provide his children an education; Mr. Santos did not have the opportunity to study due to previous cultural beliefs in his community that are now very different.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Santos Pedro de 48 años de edad, casado de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a sus 6 hijos conjuntamente con su esposa, cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los prestamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es una persona muy conocida, con residencia en la Aldea Vásquez del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un crédito para la compra de materia prima y generar mas empleos en su comunidad haciendo a que los jóvenes que necesitan trabajo también generen ingresos para sus familias, con esto podrá cubrir la demanda de su clientela y así podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia, dandoles estudios a sus hijos, ya que don santos pedro no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque anteriormente la cultura en su comunidad era muy diferente.

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials for crafts

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo is a very active person who is very dedicated to his family. He has lived with his spouse Cinthia for the past 6 years and they have one 5 year old daughter who currently attends pre-school.

Arnaldo studied through his second year of electrical engineering and at the same time, ran his own refrigeration and electronics workshop. Due to the large number of customers he had and the great demand on his time from his job, he could not finish his studies.

Today, he has many satisfied customers who appreciate the work he provides with great care and patience. He repairs all types of appliances like freezers, fridges, televisions, radios, etc.

He hopes to someday have his own locale for his workshop since he currently works in a rented space. He hopes to increase his income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Arnaldo is a very responsible person who fights daily to improve his business and the state of his family. He would like to purchase materials and tools for his job.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Arnaldo es una persona muy activa y muy dedicada a su familia, vive en pareja con Cinthia hace 6 años. Tiene 1 hija de 5 años de edad, que ya va al pre-escolar.

Arnaldo realizó sus estudios hasta el segundo año de ingeniería electrónica y a la vez ya contaba con su propio taller de refrigeración y electricidad. Fue por la alta cantidad de clientes tenía y a la gran demanda de su trabajo que no pudo culminar sus estudios.

Hoy en día todavía cuenta con muchos clientes quienes se encuentran muy satisfechos con el trabajo que con esmero y paciencia realiza. Repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos como congeladoras, heladeras, televisores, radios, etc.

Su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener su local propio y así montar en el su propio taller, debido a que trabaja en un local alquilado. El desea aumentar sus ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Arnaldo es una persona muy sacrificada y muy responsable, que día a día lucha por llevar adelante su negocio y también a su familia. Arnaldo desea adquirir materiales y herramientas para su trabajo-

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for electronics

loans.name: Pedro Clemente

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro V., age 28, is married and weaves traditional clothing. He resides in the Aldea Vásquez, in the department and municipality of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has two looms in two separate locations in the same village, he and his wife work in one while an employee works at the other. From an early age he worked on manufacturing traditional fabrics, since his parents were not able to provide an education due to their living conditions. Being a young and enthusiastic worker, he harvested the knowledge he gained from his father and started his own workshop. Now he needs to increase his capital to by buy raw materials and two looms and thus also generate more jobs and help improve the standard of living for both his employees and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pedro Vásquez de 28 años de edad, casado de oficios Tejedor “Fabricante de cortes Típicos” con residencia en la Aldea Vásquez del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala, Cuenta con un taller de 2 telares en diferentes lugares de la misma Aldea en la cual él y su esposa trabajan en la misma y cuentan con un empleado. Desde su temprana edad ya laboraba en la fabricación de cortes típicos, ya que sus padres no le pudieron dar estudio debido a las condiciones de vida que tenían, siendo un joven entusiasta trabajo y cosecho los conocimientos de su padre e inicio su propio taller, con la cual ahora necesita incrementar su capital, comprando materia prima y dos telares mas y asi también generara empleos y ayudara a mejorar su condición de vida tanto la de sus trabajadores como la de su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase raw materials for fabrication of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel R. R. is a school bus driver and has been for five years. The bus that he owns works very well, but he wants to save money and gas and hopes to buy a Diesel motor since the fuel of this machine is more economic. He makes various trips since since he drives kids from their home to the school and vice versa.

Señor R. desires this change in his motor, for which he requests $1000 dollars.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Manuel R. R. es chofer de transporte escolar desde hace 5 años, el camión que el tiene funciona muy bien, pero el quiere ahorrarse dinero y gasolina y desea comprar una motor de Diesel nuevo ya que el combustible de este aparato es mas económico. El hace varios viajes ya que el lleva a los niños de su casa a la escuela y viceversa.

El señor R. desea este cambio en su motor por lo que el solicita $1,000 dólares.

loans.use: To buy a diesel motor.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
This group called El Progreso (Progress), was formed due to the hard-working attitude of Mrs. Agueda R. who currently serves as group president and found out about the program through a neighbor who also participates in an Enterprising Women Group. Agueda invited her neighbors to an information session in her home and the group formed very quickly. The Progress Group is located in the city of Capiata.

The group members are very appreciative of the loan and are a very strong group. They are very faithful women who all participate in their weekly meetings in order to collect funds to pay back the loan.

Currently, the group participates in big activities to collect funds since one of their group members has fallen ill, so they have come together to help her finance the costs of treating her sickness. The group shows significant solidarity and sympathy always helping each other. The group consists of 17 hard-working women that works in a variety of activities.

The Progress Group stands out as an excellent group as they have a record of zero late payments. They will use the loan to help them in such activities as: the sale of cleaning products, cosmetics, notions, food, chickens, charcoal, clothing, and fabrics for making clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado El Progreso se conformó mediante la actitud emprendedora de la Sra. Agueda R., actual presidenta del grupo quien se enteró del programa mediante una vecina que ya es parte de un Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Informó a sus vecinas que se realizaría una reunión informativa en su casa y rápidamente se conformó el Grupo. El Comité “El Progreso” se encuentra localizado en la ciudad de Capiatá.

Las integrantes valoran el préstamo y cuentan con una comisión muy sólida, son muy cumplidas, semanalmente participan de sus reuniones semanales realizando actividades para la recaudación de fondos.

Actualmente el Comité realiza grandes actividades para recaudación de dinero ya que una de las integrantes se encuentra muy enferma y de ese modo poder ayudarla para costear los gastos de su enfermedad, de ese modo las mismas demuestran la solidaridad y la comprensión al brindarse apoyo entre ellas. El grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres trabajadoras que realizan diversas actividades.

Se destaca la acción del Comité El Progreso, el grupo cuenta con cero días de atraso, es un excelente Comité. Ellas retirarán el crédito para invertirlos en las actividades que consisten en: venta de productos de limpieza, cosméticos y mercería; venta de comidas, venta de gallinas, venta de carbón, venta de ropas y confección de ropas.

loans.use: The group memebers will purchase cosmetics, clothing, charcoal, lingerie, household goods, fabric to make clothing, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 45 years old, married and the mother of five children, all of whom are currently in school. For the last 12 years, she has made a living selling jeans, blouses, skirts, slippers, handbags and plastic materials. Sara's capital was provided by her husband, but not in amounts sufficient to buy high-quality products. She has applied for a loan to buy those types of items as a way to increase her sales. She will use the money to buy better-quality jeans, women's clothing and slippers.

Sara belongs to the community group called the "Yesu ne yen anidaso" (Jesus is Our Hope) Trust Group. Members of the group guarantee loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy jeans clothes, women's clothing and slippers

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina T. is 40 years old. She is a widow and the mother of six kids. Augustina is very resourceful for her family in provision of food and payment of bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as plastics. She sells kenkey in the mornings and switches over to the sale of plastic materials in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch, and supper.

Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called "Yesu ne yen anidaso" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa M. is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are currently in school. For the past eight years, she has operated a clothing shop where she sells jeans, blouses and skirts, women slippers, dressing bags and headscarfs. Yaa would like to expand her business but currently lacks sufficient funds to make that happen. She is applying for a loan to inject more working capital into her company and help it expand. She believes that his loan will make her better able to buy high-quality goods in sufficient amounts to meet customer needs. She wants to use the money to buy jeans, women's clothing, headscarfs and slippers. She belongs to an organization called Yesu ne yen anidaso (Jesus is our hope) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee to help one another repay their loan.

loans.use: To buy jeans, women's clothing and slippers

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is 47 years old, and remained in education until the fourth year of primary school. She is married, a mother of eight children, and was born and lives in the Town Centre of Ccotos, sector No. 1. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño, Capachica, in the Puno Region. She has spent 20 years working, making plaster and delivery orders every two to three months , totalling 450 to 500 bags of plaster in the city of Puno. She currently has two ovens. With this loan of S /. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay in 4 installments, she will be able to excavate the land to retrieve the raw material needed to process plaster, using heavy machinery, which takes 8 hours. This will cost S /. 1200.00 Nuevos Soles. She will work the ground to obtain her product with greater ease, which will cost S /. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles. This is land which has enough raw material to process plaster, enabling her to then sell it in the city of Puno. Ysabel is delighted to work with the Banco Comunal because it is contributing to her capital. His vision is to expand the plaster factory together with her husband, and support their children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isabel tiene 47 años de edad, estudió cuarto año de primaria, casada, madre de ocho hijos, nació y vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos, sector Nº 1. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño, Distrito de Capachica, Región Puno, hace 20 años se dedica a la fábrica de yeso y entrega pedidos cada dos a tres meses la cantidad de 450 a 500 bolsas de yeso en la ciudad de Puno, actualmente cuenta con dos hornos. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, hará excavar la tierra para sacar la materia prima para el procesado de yeso con maquinaria pesada en un tiempo de 08 horas, que pagará un monto de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, hará trabajar el camino para sacar su producto con mayor facilidad, el cual pagará S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el lugar del denuncio tiene bastante materia prima para el procesado del yeso y su posterior venta en la ciudad de Puno. Doña Ysabel se siente muy contenta de trabajar con el Banco Comunal porque aumentó su capital. Su visión es ampliar la fábrica de yeso, conjuntamente con su esposo y apoyar en la educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in land excavation

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby D. est mariée et mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle veut avec ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de fruits locaux comme les mangues et les melons. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Aby D. is married and the mother of 7 children with 2 additional children in her care. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business selling local fruits such as mangoes and melons. She hopes to improve living conditions for her children and assure them of a good education. She intends to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of local fruits

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is 27 years old and comes from Centro Poblado de Conduriri, in Santa Rosa, Collao. She lives with her partner and is a mother of two small boys and a girl. Her oldest is 7 and the youngest 3. She studied right up until the 5th year in secondary school and now lives in Av. José Antonio Chambilla s/n Barrio Alianza -Mazocruz. She has been a member of the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez for 9 years, and with her first loan of S/. 300.00 'Nuevos Soles' she started her grocery store business. Her love for business started when she was just 12 years old, selling bread. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 'Nuevos Soles', which she will pay in 4 installment, she will buy fizzy drinks, cookies, sugar, rice and stationary such as notebooks, cards, pencils etc. Her vision for the future is to better equip her store and change it into a proper store where she can offer a whole range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Alicia tiene 27 años de edad es natural del Centro Poblado de Conduriri, del Distrito de Santa Rosa de la Provincia del Collao, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos y una hija que son pequeños, el mayor de 07 años y el menor de 03 años, ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, actualmente vive en la Av. José Antonio Chambilla s/n Barrio Alianza -Mazocruz. Hace 09 años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles empezó su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella manifiesta que siempre le gustó hacer negocio empezando a la edad de 12 años a vender pan. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará gaseosas, galletas, azúcar, arroz y útiles de escritorio como cuadernos, cartulinas, lapiceros, etc. Su visión futura es equipar más su tienda y convertir en una bodega donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de productos.

loans.use: To buy different produce (groceries).

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is 53 years old and the mother of four children. She is a local manufacturer of soap. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce soap in large quantities due to lack of funds, however.

Beatrice wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise more income to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called King Jesus Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is from the Parcialidad de Calasaya – Mazocruz. She is 50 years old, and she studied until the 5th year of primary school. She lives with her partner, and is the mother of three children. She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n – Barrio Alianza.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz for about 8 years. With her first loan of /. 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to buy 1 box of tomatos, 1 box of apples, and 1 bag of carrots. She has spent 17 years selling fruits and vegetables. She also works selling alpaca meat that she delivers to the middlemen in the city of Tacna, with an average of 8 or 10 beheaded a week. Doña Ángela has always enjoyed her business, since she was 22 years old and beginning to sell food.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 8 head of alpaca in order to sell the meat and with the balance of S/. 200.00 nuevos soles she will invest in 1 box of tomatoes, 1 bag of carrots, and more.

She has always dreamed of raising better alpacas in order to have better earnings. Today she has her precious breed of alpacas.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela es natural de la Parcialidad de Calasaya – Mazocruz, tiene 50 años de edad, estudió quinto de primaria, es conviviente, madre de tres hijos, vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n – Barrio Alianza. Aproximadamente hace 08 años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar 01 caja de tomate , 01 caja de manzana, 01 saco de zanahoria, ella hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, también se dedica a la venta de carne de alpaca que entrega los viernes a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna, en un promedio de 08 a 10 degollados a la semana, a doña Ángela siempre le gustó hacer negocio, desde los 22 años de edad empezó a vender comida. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 08 cabezas de alpaca para su venta en carne y con el valor de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles invertirá en 01 caja de tomate ,01 saco de zanahoria y otros. Siempre soñó con criar alpacas mejoradas para tener mayores ganancias, hoy en día tiene su precio las alpacas de raza.

loans.use: To buy livestock (alpaca).  To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Tanko

texts.en:
Tanko is 48 years old and runs a small local restaurant. He is married, blessed with 11 children, and has used the income from his business to pay for five of his children to graduate from high school. Every day, Tanko prepares and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and eaten with various kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Tanko says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and he needs a loan to enable him meet these higher costs . He plans to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

He is a member of a loan group called the Asempa Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay their loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Residing in the Chuaqanaq Cantón Pachipac sector of Nahualá, Sololá, she has been dedicated to the activity of weaving, specifically the production of typical fabrics and her husband works in the agricultural field. Through the weaving business she generates income to help her husband cover the family expenses. She is coming to ASDIR to increase their work capital, and thus, cover the demand for her products which are sold in the municipalities of Nahualá and Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan in the province of Sololá. With a little more capital she would be able to sell in nearby municipalities and improve her income to provide a higher quality of life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Residente del Sector Chuaqanaq Cantón Pachipac, Nahualá, Sololá, desde hace Cinco años se dedica a la Artesanía “Tejeduría” , específicamente elaboración de telas típicas y el esposo de dedica a actividades de campo “Agricultura”, por medio de este trabajo genera ingresos económicos y ayuda a su esposo para sufragar los gastos de toda la familia, esta persona acude a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo y así poder cubrir la demanda de sus productos, estos productos son vendidos en el departamento de Chimaltenango y en el área o comunidades de los municipios de Nahualá y Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, del departamento de Sololá, con un poco más de capital estaría vendiendo en otros municipios cercanos y mejorar sus ingresos para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Increase of work capital for artisan business, specifically production of typical fabric

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia is 25 years old. She finished primary school completely. She lives with her partner, and is the mother of one 7 year old son. She lives in Jr. 28 de Julio s/n – Mazocruz.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz since the year 2001, the date she started working in her restaurant. She thinks it has been two years since she began selling alpaca meat and sheep weekly on Wednesdays and Fridays, delivering 30 or 40 beheaded ones to the middlemen in the city of Tacna.

With this loan of S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 1 sack of potatoes, 5 bags of rice, 1 bundle of carrots, and other things for her restaurant. She will also buy 5 head of alpaca for her sales in meat.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave and to have her restaurant. She is very dedicated to making her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia tiene 25 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un niño de siete años, vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio s/n – Mazocruz. Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, desde el año 2001, a la fecha viene trabajando en su restaurante, a su vez hace dos años inició con la venta de carne de alpaca, ovino entregando los miércoles y viernes semanalmente de 30 a 40 degollados a los intermediarios de la ciudad de Tacna. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará 01 saco de papa, 05 bolsas de arroz, 01 arroba de zanahoria y otros para su restaurante, a su vez comprará 05 cabezas de alpaca para su venta en carne. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y poner su restaurante, ella está muy decidida a concretar su sueño.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and livestock (alpacas).

loans.name: Caitana

texts.es:
Caitana is 37 years old. She studied until the fifth year of primary school. She is married and she has five young children. She lives in the Centro Poblado de Ccotos Sector Nº 1.

Since the year 2004 she has been a part of the Banco Comunal de Juchuy Niño – Capachica. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought 3 spindles of alpaca wool and 3 kilos of synthetic wool in order to make sweaters, jackets, etc. For the past two years she has made her products independently and sold them to the tourists that come to the Centro Poblado.

With this loan of S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 10 spindles of alpaca wool and 10 kilos of synthetic wool in order to continue making sweaters, jackets, and woolen hats.

Her vision is to have her artisan’s shop; made by hand and embroidered in cloth in the Centro Poblado for the affluence of tourism, so her children can study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Caitana cumplió 37 años de edad, estudió quinto de primaria, es casada y tiene cinco hijos menores de edad, ella vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos Sector Nº 1. Desde el año 2004 integra el Banco Comunal de Juchuy Niño – Capachica, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 03 conos de lana de alpaca y 03 kilos de lana sintética para tejer chompas, chalecos, etc. Desde los doce años teje individualmente y vende sus productos a los turistas que van a su Centro Poblado. Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 10 conos de lana de alpaca y 10 kilos de lana sintética para seguir tejiendo chompas, chalecos y chullos. Su visión es poner su tienda de artesanía; tejido a mano y bordados en bayeta en el mismo Centro Poblado por la afluencia de turismo, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy better wool

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia is 50 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who still depend on her. She finished primary school completely. She lives in the Comunidad de Pusuyo.

She is affiliated with the Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza in the community of de Pusuyo, in the District of Ilave, Province of Collao, Puno Region. She has been with the Banco Comunal for two years. Lacking capitol to further increase her earnings, with the first loan she bought three lambs at S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles each. With the rest she bought beads and alpaca wool in order to make beaded braiding.

With this loan of S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a small bull to fatten for S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles. The rest of the capital would buy beads and alpaca wool for the braided adornments that she would sell in Ilave.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave so that her children can study and later buy 5 or 6 head of cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cecilia cumplió 50 años de edad, es casada, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, estudió primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Pusuyo. Es socia del Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza de la comunidad de Pusuyo, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, hace dos años se asoció al Banco Comunal por falta de capital para incrementar más sus ganancias, con su primer préstamo compró tres corderos a S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno, con el resto compró mostasillas, lana de alpaca para realizar las trensillas de mostasillas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará un torete con S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles para engorde y con el resto del capital comprará mostasillas y lana de alpaca para las trensillas, esto será vendido en Ilave. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la Ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien y posteriormente comprar de 05 a 06 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde.

loans.use: To buy materials (beads and wool).  To buy livestock (1 bull).

loans.name: Clarita

texts.es:
Claria is 20 years old. She lives with her partner and she has a 7 month old daughter. She finished primary school completely, and is from Parcialidad de Huayllaphujo – Mazocruz. She lives in Avenue Tacna s/n.

She has worked with the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez for one year. With her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she was able to buy 5 cans of gas that she later sold. She was able to increase her capital and changed her business to buying livestock, alpacas, llamas, lambs, and pig fattening.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will by 6 alpacas in order to fatten and later sell them.

Each alpaca costs S/. 130.00 Nuevos Soles. Her goal is to have her own house in Mazocruz and to install a tap in order to sell gas, and that her daughter studies and becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Clarita cumplió 20 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de siete meses, estudió primaria completa, natural de la Parcialidad de Huayllaphujo – Mazocruz, vive en la Av. Tacna s/n. Trabaja con el Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez hace un año, con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 05 latas de petróleo para su posterior venta, conforme fue aumentando su capital cambió de negocio a la compra de ganado, alpacas, llamas, corderos en pie y engorde de porcinos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 06 alpacas cada alpaca cuesta S/. 130.00 Nuevos Soles para engorde y luego vender. Su meta es tener su casa propia en Mazocruz e instalar un grifo para vender combustible, que su hija estudie y sea profesional.

loans.use: To buy alpacas

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school while the other two have graduated. Susana has much experience with customer service, having been in the business of selling yams and dried fish for twenty years as a way to support her family. She treks to nearby farming communities to buy her stock of yams, and she gets her fish from fish mongers. This saves her the cost of dealing with middlemen, who buy from farmers and resell to stores at a higher price.

Susana has applied for a loan to buy yams in bulk and enough dried fish to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay for her children's education. Susana is a member of a loan group called Ruth Love Trust Group. Members guarantee and support one another in the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To buy yams and dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea is married, and she is 68 years old. She studied only until the first year of primary school. She is the mother of 7 children, and she lives in a block of the plaza called Armas de Centro Poblado, in Mazocruz, in the Santa Rosa District of the Province of Collao de la Región Puno.

With a first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she was able to buy more vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc. in order to continue preparing viandas (food), a business that she has worked at for several years.

Because of her age, two years ago she changed her business. Currently she has a small snack store, and she also makes bread together with her spouse.

With this loan of S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she would buy ingredients to make bread, sweets, cookies, and soda pop. “Thanks to the loans that I have gotten from the Banco Comunal, I have increased my business and my earnings,” says a very satisfied Doña Dorotea.

Her greatest wish is that her youngest daughter would become a professional, and that the older children don’t have to stop studying because of a lack of economic means.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea está casada, tiene 68 años de edad, estudió solo primer año de primaria, es madre de siete hijos y vive a una cuadra de la plaza de Armas de Centro Poblado de Mazocruz . Hace siete años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Centro Poblado de Mazocruz , Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao de la Región Puno, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar más verduras, papa, carne, etc. Para seguir preparando viandas (comida), negocio que se dedicó varios años. Por su edad hace dos años cambió de negocio, actualmente cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes dedicándose también a la elaboración de pan, conjuntamente con su esposo. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para la elaboración de pan, golosinas, galletas y gaseosas. “Gracias a los créditos que obtuve del Banco Comunal he incrementando mi negocio y más ganancias” manifestó muy contenta doña Dorotea Su mayor deseo es que su hija menor sea profesional, ya que los hijos mayores no pudieron estudiar por falta de medios económicos.

loans.use: To buy various food ingredients and products

loans.name: Guillermina Leonor

texts.es:
Miss Guillermina Leonor is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She studied medical assistant. She doesn’t practice her profession because she has a 26-year-old special child, who suffers from convulsions and has to take care of him. Her 19-year-old youngest son studies information technology. She lives in the District of Paiján in the Province of Ascope, at the Department La Liberad. First, she obtained a job teaching basic literacy in the countysiD., but she moved back because she had to take care of her child. In order to be in a better economic situation, she started selling Ebel cosmetic products, soda drinks, sweets, adornments for gifts six years ago. A friend recommended her to the Communal Bank “ HONESTY AND CONFIDENCE ”, now she has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. With the first loan of $300, she bought ceramic adornments, screens, cups, and glasses. With this loan of $1800 that she will repay over a period of 6 months, she plans to invest this money in buying pictures, perfumes, cookies, chocolates. The partner wish is to buy equipment for her business and a tv set for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guillermina Leonor, tiene 53 años, está casada, tiene 02 hijos, estudió secretariado médico, no ejerce su profesión porque tiene un niño especial D. 26 años, que sufre D. convulsiones y tiene que cuidarlo, su hijo menor D. 19 años actualmente estudia computación, vive en el Distrito D. Paiján en la Provincia D. Ascope en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Primeramente consiguió un trabajo D. alfabetización en las campiñas, pero se retiró porque tenía que cuidar a su niño. Posteriormente para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 06 años a vender productos cosméticos D. Ebel, gaseosa, golosina, adornos para regalos. Una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “HONESTIDAD Y CONFIANZA”, ahora tiene 03 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró adornos D. cerámica, pantallas, tazas, vasos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1800.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. cuadros, perfumes, galletas, chocolates. La socia sueña con seguir adelante, y comprar 01 equipo, 01 televisor para su casa.

loans.use:
Buy pictures, perfumes and sweets
.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Miss Patricia is 42 years old and she finished secondary education. She didn’t keep on studying because her family didn’t have the economic resources. Her Dad was a mechanic and her Mom was a housewife, and they had several children. The partner has 2 children who are in school. She lives in the District of Paiján in the Province of Ascope, at the Department of La Libertad. Patricia started with a small business, selling detergents, sodas, and sweets but in small quantities. She received a capital of $50 from an ONG from the US. This money was used to start the business. A friend encouraged her to be part of the Communal Bank “ HONESTY AND CONFIDENCE ”. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. With the first loan of $300, she bought toilet paper, rice, chicken, sweets, eggs, bread, etc. With this loan of $3,000, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she plans to invest in buying a scaffold, a showcase and food for birds. The partner is the secretary at the Communal Bank where she belongs. Her functions are to keep a record of what happens during the meetings. Her wish is to expand her business in order to help her son with his superior studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Patricia, tiene 42 años, estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando por la economía, sus padres no tenían solvencia económica, su Papá era mecánico y su Mamá era ama D. casa, tenían varios hijos. La socia tiene 02 hijos son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito D. Paiján en la Provincia D. Ascope en el Departamento D. La Libertad. La empresaria empezó con un pequeño negocio en el cual vendía detergentes, gaseosas, golosinas pero en pequeña cantidad, ella recibió un capital D. 50 dólares D. una ONG D. EEUU, este dinero estaba destinado para que inicien un negocio. Una amiga la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “HONESTIDAD Y CONFIANZA”, tiene 04 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró papel higiénico, arroz, pollo, golosinas, huevos, pan, etc. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, que cancelará en 06 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra D. 01 andamio, 01 vitrina y comida para aves. La socia tiene el cargo D. secretaria en el Banco Comunal al que pertenece, cuya función es llenar en el acta, según lo que se acuerD. en reunión. Ella sueña con ampliar el negocio para ayudar a su hijo en los estudios superiors

loans.use: Buy a scaffold, a showcase and food for birds.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Miss Maria del Pilar is 25 years old. She is married, she studied to be an Executive Assistant. She doesn’t practice her career because she decided to take care of her children. She has 2 children, they are both in school. She lives in the District of Paiján in the Province of Ascope, at the Department of La Libertad. In order to help her family economically, she started selling footwear, school supplies, and underwear a year ago. Since her uncle has a footwear business in Lima, Maria buys the products to him according to the number of orders. Her aunt recommended her to the Communal Bank " HONESTY AND CONFIDENCE”, she decided to be part of Manuela Ramos. With the first loan of $300, she bought jewel cases, gifts, plush toys, notebooks, clothes, etc. With the loan of $300.00 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she wants to invest in buying sandals and shoes. Maria wished is to have a bigger business selling toys, linens, and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María del Pilar, tiene 25 años, está casada, estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, no ejerce su profesión porque se comprometió y tiene que cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Paiján en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 01 año a vender calzado, útiles, ropa interior y como su tío tiene un negocio de calzado en Lima, la socia le compra según el número de pedidos. Su tía la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “HONESTIDAD Y CONFIANZA”, ella decidió participar en Manuela Ramos por la facilidad de prestar dinero a bajos intereses y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró joyeritos, regalos, peluches, cuadernos, ropa, etc. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de sandalias, zapatos. La empresaria sueña con tener un negocio mas grande de juguetería, lencería, calzado.

loans.use: Buy footwear.

loans.name: Celia Benita

texts.es:
Miss Celia Benita is 43 years old. She finished secondary education. She used to help her Dad sell bread, but she got married and now she has 4 children. She lives in the District of Razuri in the Province of Ascope, at the Department of La Libertad. Since her husband is a fisherman and he didn’t have work all the time, she started selling rice zambito (rice, pecans and caramel sauce), rice with milk, toffee, maize with honey, cake of yucca and pumpkin fritters. She got an invitation from a friend to join the Communal Bank “MALABRIGO II”. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1 year, 7 months. With the first loan of $300 she bought cornstarch, impalpable sugar, grated coconut, and butter. With this loan of $500 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she wants to invest in buying a showcase to display her products, a table, cornstarch, and flour. The partner wished to have her own oven, and to be able to go out to sell her products to different shops.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Celia Benita, tiene 43 años, estudió secundaria completa, ayudaba a vender pan a su Papá, pero luego se comprometió, tiene 04 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como su esposo es pescador y no tenía un trabajo seguro, empezó a vender arroz zambito, arroz con leche, tofee, mazamorra, pastel de yuca, picarones. Recibió una invitación de una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “MALABRIGO II”, tiene 01 año 07 meses trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró maicena, azúcar impalpable, manjar blanco, coco rayado, manteca. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de 01 vitrina, 01 mesa, maicena, harina, manjar blanco. La socia sueña con tener un horno propio, salir a vender a las tiendas.

loans.use: Buy supplies,a showcase and a table.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Residing in Cantón Palanquix Guachiaquib in Nahualá, Sololá, he has for 2 year been working in his own business of buying and selling grinding stones. Previously he worked for other people and wasn't paid much, but currently, through his business he obtains the income to cover the food, clothing and school expenses for his four children. He has come to ASDIR to request a loan to increase his work capital and thus buy raw materials and tools. Later, he plans to create jobs for other people to cover the demand for his products and generate more income for the well-being of his family. These products are sold in the locale of Nahualá, in the capital city and in other nearby municipalities.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Residente del Cantón Palanquix Guachiaquib, Nahualá, Sololá, desde hace dos años se dedica a su propio negocio o sea al Comercio “Compra y Venta de Piedras de Moler”, anteriormente trabajaba para otras personas y no era mucho lo que le pagaban, actualmente por medio de este negocio obtiene sus ingresos económicos para sufragar los gastos alimenticios, ropa de toda la toda la familia y estudio de sus cuatro hijos, esta persona acude a ASDIR para solicitar una ampliación de su capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima y herramientas; luego piensa contratar o generar empleo a otras personas y poder cubrir la demanda de sus productos y generar mas ingresos o ganancias para el bienestar de su familia, estos productos son vendidos en la población de Nahualá, en la ciudad capital y en otros municipios cercanos .

loans.use: Increase in work capital for his business of purchase and sale of grinding stones

loans.name: Alicia Margarita

texts.es:
Miss Alicia Margarita is 53 years old, she studied up 5th year of secondary educaion. She did not keep on studying because the family didn’t have the economic means for it. Her Dad was a lot older than her Mom, then he got sick and couldn’t keep on working. Since Alicia was the oldest, she had to start working from a very young age to support her family. Now, She has 9 children, 3 are students and 6 work. She lives in the District of Razuri in the Province of Ascope, at the Department of La Libertad. The businesswoman started selling sweets and simultaneously she was preparing cakes, but since the people wanted to pay on credit and didn’t repaid in time; she decided to change business 4 months ago. Now she prepares and sells a varied menu and offers it to the workers of the factories in the Port of Malabrigo. Alicia has being employed at Manuela Ramos for 1 year, and she belongs to the Communal Bank "MALABRIGO II". With the first loan of $300 she bought sweets. With this loan of $1,000 that she will repaid over a period of 6 months, she will invest this money in buying 2 sacks of rice, 1 box of oil, 2 bags of sugar, spices, vegetables, vegetable stews, etc. She dreams of having a restaurant and support her children so that they can go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alicia Margarita, tiene 53 años, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque no había medios económicos, su Papá era demasiado mayor que su Mamá, luego el señor estuvo enfermo y por su edad ya no podía seguir trabajando, posteriormente la socia por ser hija mayor tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para el sustento de su familia, tiene 09 hijos, 03 son estudiantes y 06 se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria empezó a vender golosinas y a la vez preparaba tortas, pero como la gente quiere a crédito y no cancela a tiempo las deudas contraídas, entonces la socia decidió cambiar de negocio hace 04 meses, ahora se dedica a la venta de menú variado y les ofrece a los trabajadores de las fábricas en el Puerto Malabrigo. La socia tiene 01 año trabajando en Manuela Ramos y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MALABRIGO II”, y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró golosinas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que cancelará en 06 cuotas mensuales tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de 02 sacos de arroz, 01 caja de aceite, 02 bolsas de azúcar, condimentos, verduras, menestras, etc. Ella sueña con tener un restaurant y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.

loans.use: Buy supplies.

loans.name: Zoila Belinda

texts.es:
Miss Zoila Belinda is 44 years old. She studied the career of Early Education for special children in the city of Lima for 9 months, but she had to stop because she has to start working to support her parents, her Dad didn’t have a job at the time. Zoila later came to the Port of Chicama; she got married and now she has 5 children. They all are independent, work, and live in the District of Razuri in the Province of Ascope at the Department of La Libertad. In order to support her husband economically she started selling ceramics and artificial flowers 12 years ago. Later, she received an invitation from a friend to be part of the Communal Bank “MALABRIGO II”. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With the first loan of $300, she bought flowers, vases, musical plush animals, sweaters, etc. With this loan of $400 that she will repaid over a period of four payments; she will invest this money in buying blankets, sweaters, ponchos, caps, gloves, vests, coffee pots, pictures, briefcases, etc. The partner wishes is to keep on being employed at Manuela Ramos, an be able to buy a showcase to display her products to the clients and to keep on investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila Belinda, tiene 44 años, estudió la carrera de Educación Inicial para niños especiales en la ciudad de Lima durante 09 meses pero se retiró porque tenía que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, su Papá no tenía trabajo, la socia después vino al Puerto Chicama, se comprometió y ahora tiene 05 hijos, los cuales son independientes y trabajan, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad.
