She is 22 years old and the mother of one small daughter. Her husband is a skilled laborer. With the first $100 loan Crystell received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of food.

Now, Crystell has a motorbike which her husband drives while she sells regional fruits from the patio of her home; additionally, on Sundays she sells ceviche, a local delicacy.

With this $675 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the maintenance of her motorbike and in the purchase of fruit.

Crystell is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank since it has allowed her to become more independent and earn a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Crystell, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en AA. HH. Javier Pérez, Jr. Guillermo Sisley Mz.A Lt.25 del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años es madre de una pequeña niña. Y su esposo es obrero. Crystell con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 soles decidió invertir en venta de comida. En la actualidad Crystell cuenta con un motokar, el cual es manejado por su esposo, paralelamente se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en el patio de su casa y los días domingos vende su ceviche (comida típica). Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motokar y compra de frutas. Crystell, esta muy agradecida con el Banco de Manuela Ramos ya que de tal manera ha podido independizarse y así mismo puede dar un ingreso mas a su familia.

loans.use: Motorbike maintenance and purchase of fruits

loans.name: Jairo José

texts.es:
Jairo B. is a miller in the county of Nagarote in the city of Leon. He is father to 2 kids who are at school and this is why he works so hard at his job.

It is important to mention that despite the difficult situations that he has been through for some years he has managed to move forward and bring food to the table. Now he needs economic recourses to buy work materials and to maintain the machinery. It is for this reason that he went to Ceprodel; to obtain the necessary credit and in this way continue the business for his and his family's benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Jairo B. se dedica a laborar en su negocio de servicio de molino atendido en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Es padre de dos niños en edad escolar y esta es la razón por la cual se ha esforzado grandemente en este negocio.

Es de importancia destacar que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones adversas que este caballero ha atravesado desde hace varios años, ha logrado salir adelante y llevado el sustento a su mesa. Hoy en día la necesidad que él atraviesa es la falta del recurso económico para compra del material de trabajo y mantenimiento de la maquinaria. Por este motivo es que sin dudarlo acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario y de esta manera continuar con el negocio para beneficio de él y de su amada familia.

loans.use: To buy work materials and to maintain the mill machines/Compra de materiales de trabajo y mantenimiento de maquinas de molino

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es:
Juana M. is originally from the city of Leon and lives in the county of Nagarote. She dedicates herself to the arduous labor of sewing, and has done so for long 30 years. She has acquired great experience making trousers, shirts and all types of clothing.

Being a widow she doesn't get any financial help from her partner, so she works hard to sustain her household. It is for this reason that she is seeking help from Ceprodel. She would like credit to buy some materials which she works with and to continue to maintain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana M. es originaria de la ciudad de León habitando en el municipio de Nagarote y se dedica a su ardua labor de costura dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 30 largos años habiendo adquirido gran experiencia en la elaboración de pantalones, camisas y todo tipo de costura.

A pesar que ella es una dama viuda a partir de que no recibe el apoyo económico de su cónyuge, inicia a laborar fuertemente duplicando sus esfuerzos para llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Por este motivo es que una vez más busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual adquirir los materiales de trabajo y continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy work materials/Compra de materiales de trabajo

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia C. has been selling food and making tortillas in the county of Nagarote in the city of Leon for 10 years. She is a hard-working woman who has managed to move forward thanks to her sales and due to her ample experience making the dishes she sells.

Nowadays she would like Ceprodel's support with some credit in order to buy basic ingredients to make foods. She is confidently waiting for her request to be authorized so she can continue with her business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La dama María Eugenia C. se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de alimentos y elaboración de tortillas en su municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León. Es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus ventas y además por su amplia experiencia en la elaboración de estos platillos. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que su solicitud le será otorgada y así logrará continuar con su negocio en su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To sell food/Venta de comida

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
In the county of Nagarote, in the city of Leon, Maria Ofelia has been making and selling 'quesillos' (a corn tortilla wrapped around melted cheese) for 11 years. She sells them walking around the streets of the county. She has made a great effort and has managed to move forward with her family which is made up of 5 young kids who she has to support and give all they need in life.

Now she needs to make quesillos to sell but does not have enough money, so she sought the help of Ceprodel to get some credit to buy basic ingredients to make the quesillos and in this way continue her business in the county of Nagarote.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 11 años, en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la señora Maria Ofelia Lopez se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesillos ofreciéndolos ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio. Esta dama se ha esforzado grandemente y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su humilde familia compuesta por sus cinco pequeños hijos a los que tiene que mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias de vida. Hoy en día, con la necesidad de elaborar los quesillos para su venta y al hacerle falta el recurso económico busca ayuda en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los quesillos y de esta manera continuar con su negocio en el municipio de Nagarote.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Marta Azucena

texts.es:
The county of Nagarote in the city of Leon is characterized by the very important role that cattle and agriculture play in the community's economy. Marta Lopez L. has had a business rearing cattle and cows to obtain milk to sell it and thereby support her young son.

Nowadays she urgently needs to acquire more cows to raise and to milk. It is because of this that she is looking for the support of Ceprodel; to get some credit in order to move forward and give her family better living conditions which they so deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de Leon se caracteriza por ser un local donde la ganaderia y agricultura juegan un papel importantisiimo para la economia de la comunidad. La señora Marta Lopez L. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería por medio de la crianza de ganado como lo son las vacas con el proposito de obtener la leche para comercializarla y de igual forma para proporcionarsela a su pequño hijo.

Hoy en dia la necesidad que ella atraviesa es con urgencia la adquisición del ganado para la crianza con el proposito de extraer la leche. Por este motivo es que busca el apoyo en Cepordel para obtener el credito para salir adelante y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su fmilia que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy cows to rear/Compra de vacas para crianza

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha Sanchez has put a lot of effort into her store where she has offered fuel products for 5 years. She started her business with very little capital but thanks to her great efforts she has managed to move forward and improve her family's living conditions.

Her greatest need nowadays is to acquire economic recourses to buy merchandise. It is for this reason alone that she went to Ceprodel; to get credit in this way in order for her business to move forward and to improve the living conditions of the family she so loves.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha S. se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería donde ofrece productos comestibles desde hace cinco años. Su negocio inició con poco capital de trabajo pero gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

La necesidad atravesada hoy en día por esta dama es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para adquirir la mercadería. Es por esta única razón que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que tanto ama .

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de los productos

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel D. L. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Jose Manuel D. L. M.. I am married and I have two children. My mom also lives with us and we need to construct in our home a wall since there is a lot of insecurity. We also need to finish the repairs on a bathroom because the one we have is very small and has a lot of humidity. For lack of money, we have not been able to finish these projects. For this reason we are requesting this support. I work in a warehouse of Coca Cola and my wife is an operator in an assembly plant. We both have some years working here."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es Jose Manuel D. L. M., soy casado y tengo 2 hijos, mi mama vive también con nosotros y necesitamos construir en nuestra casa una barda ya que hay mucha inseguridad, también necesito terminar la reparacion D. un baño porque el que tenemos esta muy pequeño y tiene mucha humedad, por falta D. dinero no hemos podido realizar estos proyectos es por eso que solicitamos este apoyo, yo trabajo en un Almacén D. la Coca Cola y mi esposa es operadora en una Maquila los dos tenemos algunos años trabajando ahí”

loans.use: Construct a wall and repair a bathroom.

loans.name: Aura Leticia

texts.es:
Aura Leticia Vásquez García is 19 years old, single and lives in Paraje Xequiac of Cantón Xantún in the province of Totonicapán. She has been working for more than two years as a seamstress producing aprons and now she is requesting a loan in Asociación Asdir that she will used to buy a work machine and raw material with the aim of generating more production and income to benefit her and her family. She is requesting a loan to be able to develop herself and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Aura Leticia Vásquez García de 19 años de edad, Soltera, con residente en el Paraje Xequiac, del Cantón Xantún, del departamento de Totonicapán quien hace más de 2 años atrás viene trabajando como costurera en la elaboración de delantales y ahora pretender solicitar en la Asociación Asdir un crédito que le servirá para comprar una máquina de trabajo y comprar materia prima con la idea de generar mas producción y ganancias para el beneficio de ella misma y de su familia por esa razón solicita a la Institución un credito que le permita desarrollarse o superarse la cual cancalifica al crédito por la supervisión efectuada.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery and raw materials

loans.name: Barbara Jeanette

texts.es:
Bárbara Jeanette S. T. is 21 years old, single and currently lives on 3rd Avenue 3-37, Zona 1, Totonicapán. She has been working for more than 3 years in a leather goods shops making sandals for women and girls, in a variety of styles and designs. She delivers her work in Huehuetenango and in Mesilla and came to the offices to Asdir to request a loan that will let her grow and develop in the local market with a variety of products and increase her small workshop. She wants to be able to go other provinces in Guatemala to market her products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Bárbara Jeanette S. T. de 21 años de edad, Soltera, actualmente reside en la 3ra. Avenida 3-37 Zona 1, Totonicapán. Hace mas de 4 años viene trabajando en la talabartería elaborando sandalias para damas y niñas, con variedad de estilos y diseños. Entregando su producción en Huehuetenango y en la Mesilla y se acerco al a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito con ello le permite crecer y desarrollarse en el mercado local con la variedad de sus productos e incrementar su pequeño taller, atraves del financiamiento y con ello atender otros departamentos de Guatemala en la comercializacion de produccion.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and accessories

loans.name: Jesus Adan

texts.es:
Jesús Adan A. P., 37 years old, married and lives in the Paraje Coxom, Cantón Patzarajmac in the Totonicapán province. He currently works as a merchant selling typical clothes for girls and women. He has been doing this for more than five years, selling in the plaza of Totonicapán and Salcaja Municipio de Quetzaltenango and now sees the necessity of requesting a loan to be able to increase his work capital with the idea of having stocked merchandise for the fair in the province of Totonicapán in September, with the objective of improving the quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús Adan A. P. de 37 años de edad, Casado, y con residencia en el Paraje Coxom, Cantón Patzarajmac, del Municipio y departamento de Totonicapán quien actualmente se dedica como comerciante en la venta de ropa típica para niñas y damas ya que tiene mas de 5 años en trabajar en dicha actividad vendiendo en la plaza de Totonicapán y Salcaja Municipio de Quetzaltenango y ahora ve la necesidad de solicitar un crédito en la Institución para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo con la idea de contar con mercadería surtida en esta época de la feria del departamento de Totonicapán en el mes de Septiembre con el objetivo de mejora su nivel de vida y de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es:
Nicacio M. P. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Nicacio M. P.. I am married and have three children. I work as a security guard in a business and my wife is a homemaker. We have the need to install a bathroom in our home since we have very little space within the house and I need to add to it and make it bigger. The walls are in a very bad state, and we believe that it is not very safe for our kids and also we worry that the humidity harms them since it could make them sick."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

¨Mi nombre es NICACIO M. P. soy casado y tengo 3 hijos yo trabajo como guardia de seguridad en una empresa y me esposa es ama de casa, tenemos la necesidad de instalar un baño de nuestra vivienda ya que tenemos muy poco espacio adentro de la casa y necesito amplearme y hacerlo mas grande las paredes están en muy mal estado creemos que no es muy seguro para nuestros hijos y también les perjudica mucho la humedad ya que pueden enfermarse

loans.use: Install a bathroom.

loans.name: Marling Benita

texts.es:
Mrs. R. A. is 45 years old, she is single and has no children, sells underwear and shoes from home to home, her goal is to have a store so she can stop offering her merchandise from place to place, her wish is to be able to improve her economic situation and be able to buy one day her own house because she is currently leaving with her mother. With the loan she is requesting she wants to get more merchandise to be ready for Christmas sales, as September is so close to December; Mrs. R. has 22 years selling merchandise, this activity is an alternative to unemployment and lack of academic studies because she didn’t have the economic resources to study, so this activity is her source of income.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. A., tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos, se dedica al comercio de ropa interior femenina y masculina, calzado en general de forma ambulante, su proposito es poder llegar a tener un local fijo donde establecer su negocio y dejar de andar ofreciendo su mercaderia de forma ambulante, su deseo es poder superarse economicamente y cumplir su mayor sueño que es poder adquirir su propia vivienda ya que donde habita es de su señora madre. Con el financiamiento pretende adquirir mas mercaderia aprovechando la oportunidad que ofrece el mercado dado la temporada del mes de septiembre estando proximo al mes de diciembre; la señora tiene 22 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercaderia teniendo esta actividad como una alternativa al desempleo y a la falta de preparacion academica de la cual carece por no haber tenido el apoyo ni los recursos necesarios para lograrlo, constituyendose esta actividad en su fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Working Capital / CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Yohana De La Concepc

texts.es:
Mrs. A. R. is 33 years old, she is married and hast two young children who are in third and fifth grades respectively in school, and her husband works selling chickens with her, which is their only source of income; she has the goal to develop her business with the loan to increase her inventory of chickens. She later on sells them to near by grocery stores; her biggest dream is to see her children as professionals one day. The loan will be used as working capital to buy vitamins, food and vaccines for the chickens; her wish it to install a farm with good infrastructure and create employment. This activity started by her own initiative due the unemployment and way to improve her live.
 Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora A. R., tiene 33 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos menoes de edad, ambos cursan el tercer grado y quinto grado respectivamente de primaria, su compañero de vida se dedica al comercio de venta de pollo en pieza en conjunto con su esposa lo que constituye su unica fuente de ingresos; la señora tiene el proposito de desarrollar su negocio con el apoyo de los creditos ya que ello le ha ayudado a tener un mayor inventario de aves de corral que posteriormente en conjutno con su esposo destaza y entrega pulperias cercanas, su mayor sueño es poder ver coronada una carrera profesinal para sus hijos con el esfurzo y sacrificio de su trabajo, El financiamiento actual sera utilizado para capital de trabajo como es la compra de vitaminas, concentrado, vacunas para los pollos;  su deseo es poder instalar una granja con condiciones de infraestructura y poder genar empleos que en la actualidad no posee, ella tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual surge como una iniciativa propia ante el desempleo y una manera de querer superase en la vida

loans.use: Working Capital / Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ayde Aracely

texts.es:
Ayde Aracely G. B. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Ayde Aracely G. B.. I am single. My parents live with me and I work in the administrative department of a transportation company. I intend to change the front door of my house since I feel that it is very unsafe and it leaves me worrying for my parents when I have to leave ,due to the fact that several robberies have occurred in our neighborhood."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es AYDE ARACELY G. B. soy soltera, mis papas vivien conmigo y trabajo en el departamento administrativo de una compañía de transportes, tengo la intención de cambiar la puerta principal de mi casa ya que la siento muy insegura y me quedo preocupada por mis papas cuando tengo que salir debido a que han sucedido varios robos en nuestra colonia”

loans.use: Install a front door on her home.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Mrs. Auxiliadora V. is 58 years old; she is married and has an 18 year old son, who is currently on high school. Her husband is a carpenter, she wants to strengthen her small grocery store that she has for the past two years, and she also creates and sells traditional sweets like gofio, milk cajeta, among others for the past 25 years. She started the grocery store to survive and be able to help with the house expenses, her dream is to see her son turn into a professional and to have a very well stock store so this would produce more income she would use to improve her home. Her business is located at her house, and the loan will be use to buy rice, sugar, beans, detergent, eggs, school supplies, wood and other first necessity products her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Auxiliadora V., tiene 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, actualemente cursa el cuarto año de secundaria, su esposo es albañil, la señora tiene el proposito de poder fortalecer su pequeño negocio siendo este una pequeña pulperia la cual tiene dos años de ejecercer, tambien se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de dulces tradicionales como gofio, cajeta de leche, la cual tiene 25 años de ejercer, la señora a optado por un negocio nuevo como es la pulperia como una necesidad de poder subsistir y colaborar con los ingresos del hogar, su sueños es poder ver a su hijo realizado profesionalmente y poner una pulperia bien surtida donde ello le genere ganancias que seria invertidas en el mejoramiento de su casa y tener un hogar digno para su familia, dichos negocios estan ubicados en su casa de habitacion, el financiamiento fue exclusivamente para la compra de productos relacionados con la pulperia como es arroz. azucar, frijoles, detergentes, huevo, utiles escolares, leña, y demas productos necesarios en el hogar y que su clientela asi lo demanda.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique M. S. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Enrique M. S.. I am married and I have a daughter. I am dedicated to carpentry and I already have some clients. The work that I do for them is done here in my home, and although the space is very small, my family and I have tried to make ourselves comfortable. But now I feel that indeed I need to make an effort to add a little more space to my home since my daughter is growing."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es ENRIQUE M. S. soy casado y tengo una hija, me dedico a la carpintería tengo ya algunos clientes y los trabajo los hago ahí en mi casa, aunque el espacio es muy pequeño hemos tratado de acomodarnos, pero ahora siento que si necesito hacer un esfuerzo por ampliar un poco mas ya que también mi hija esta creciendo”.

loans.use: Add a room.

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia Estela A. N. is 37 years old, she is married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old and are studying on second and third grade of primary school, her husband works as a community instructor of viral illnesses in order to prevent them. Mrs. A. had required the loan to improve her economic conditions through her business which is to elaborate and sell baking goods, which learned from her parents. Her dream is to improve the conditions of her small bakery and create employment to others, provide studies to her children and to be one of the most well known bakeries on the local level and to create the best possible products for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia Estela A. N., tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los 5 y 7 años de edad actualmente cursan el segundo grado y tercer grado, de primaria, su esposo trabaja en el area preventiva de enfermedades de origen viral desempeñandose como instructor en las comunidades. La señora ha requerido del apoyo de nuestra institucion con el objetivo de poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas siendo este la elaboracion y venta de cosa de horno, ya que es el oficio que le heredaron su padres, su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su pequeño taller y generar empleos, por consiguiente brindar estudios a sus hijos y llegar a ser una de las proveedoras mas reconocidas a nivel local, ofreciendo para ello condiciones tecnicas para generar empleos y un producto de calidad a quien guste de su mercaderia.

loans.use: Working Capital / Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben E. G. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Ruben Espinosa G.. I am married and I have two children, but they are already older and do not live with us now. My wife and I have planned to make an addition to the front of our home, but it will have to be done little by little since the material is very expensive for us. I am a pensioner and now I am dedicated to doing construction jobs (builder); for this reason I will not have to pay for the manual labor to make the improvements on my home. My wife is the home maker and now we live alone in our home."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es RUBEN ESPINOSA G. soy casado y tengo 2 hijos pero ya son mayores y no viven con nosotros, mi esposa y yo hemos pensado en hacer una ampliación al frente de nuestra vivienda pero esto tendrá que hacer poco a poco ya que el material nos sale muy caro. Yo soy pensionado y ahora me dedico a hacer trabajos de construcción (albañil); así es que no tendré que pagar la mano de obra para hacer la mejora en mi vivienda, mi esposa en ama de casa y ahora vivimos solos en nuestra vivienda.”.

loans.use: Addition to house.

loans.name: Maciel Verenice

texts.es:
My name is Maciel Verenice Martínez E.. I am married and have 3 children. My husband is a taxi driver, and, little by little, we have tried to take our family forward. I work as a cashier in a mall. It cost us a great deal to have our house. My mother was ill, and my family and I had to go to live with her for a time because she was alone. I had to leave my house abandoned, and, as a result, the vagrant boys of the town destroyed the house, to the extent that it almost falling apart. Now, we would like to repair the house and make some modifications.

Maciel Verenice M. E. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es Maciel Verenice Martínez E. soy casada y tengo 3 hijos mi esposo es taxista y poco a poco hemos tratado de sacar a nuestra familia adelante, yo trabajo como cajera en un centro comercial y nos ha costado mucho tener nuestra casa, mi mama enfermo y mi familia y yo tuvimos que irnos a vivir un tiempo con ella ya que estaba sola, dejando mi casa abandonada y es por eso que poco a poco los muchachos vagos de la colonia la fueron destruyendo, como pueden ver esta casi cayendose ahora nos gustaría repararla y hace algunas modificaciones”

loans.use: To repair her home

loans.name: Jesus Apolonio

texts.es:
My name is Jesus Apolonia M.. I am married and have 2 children, who are already of legal age. I have had a construction business in my home for 20 years; it is called “COINSA.” I look after the business personally. I would like to invest in the purchase of materials and tools so that I will have more construction jobs and, therefore, more income.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es JESUS APOLONIO M. soy casado y tengo 2 hijos ya mayores de edad, tengo un negocio de construcción en mi vivienda desde hace 20 años y su nombre es ¨COINSA¨ yo lo atiendo personalmente, me gustaría invertir en la compra de material y herramientas de trabajo para así tener mas trabajos de construcción y por lo tanto mas ingresos.”

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction material for my business

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
My name is Dora Elia O. R., and I am a seamstress and a hard-working person. In spite of my disability, I fight to go forward. My husband is retired and, as a result, he is not able to work. Therefore, we turn to this project so that we can construct a fence in the front of our house for our protection because we live alone, because there is a lot of insecurity, and because we are older people. It is necessary that we put a cement floor in the front of the house because of my disability and so that we can use my wheelchair more easily. 

Dora Elia O. R. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi.  Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

 Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es  Dora Elia O. R. soy costurera y una persona muy trabajadora, a pesar de mi discapacidad lucho por salir adelante, mi esposo es pensionado , y debido a esto el ya no puede trabajar por eso recurrimos a este proyecto para lograr construir una barda en el frente de nuestra casita para protección de nosotros ya que estamos solos y existe mucha inseguridad y somos personas mayores; poner el piso de cemento en el frente de mi casa es una necesidad  por mi discapacidad y para poder utilizar con mas facilidad mi sillas de ruedas.”

loans.use: To construct a fence in the front of my house

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
My name is Leopoldo R. C., and I am 70 years old. I am a security guard for a company. My wife is name Nicolasa. We have a small house, where we want to raise a fence in the front of the house for our protection since we are older people. In place of this, we have some wooden platforms. Also, we need a cement floor, and with this project we want to achieve it.

Leopoldo R. Garcia is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es Leopoldo R. C. tengo 70 años y soy guardia de seguridad de una empresa, mi esposa se llama Nicolasa y esta es mi casita queremos levantar una barda en el frente, para protección de nosotros ya que somos unas personas mayores y en lugar de esta tenemos unas tarimas de madera; también necesitamos un piso de cemento y por medio de este proyecto queremos lograrlo.¨

loans.use: Improvements for his house

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Héctor Calderón V.. I am 26 years old, and I am a mechanic. I am requesting this loan because I must purchase and install windows and doors for my house since they were stolen a few months earlier. I want to install them because the insecurity is greater every day.

Héctor C. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola mi nombre es Héctor Calderón V. tengo 26 años y soy mecánico de una empresa y estoy solicitando este préstamo porque requiero de la compra e instalación de ventanas y puertas de m i casa ya que fueron robadas algunos meses atrás ; quiero instalarlas porque la inseguridad es mayor cada ves.”

loans.use: To place windows and doors in my house

loans.name: Jesus Rigoberto

texts.es:
Hello friends! My name is Jesús Rigoberto G. V.. I am a twenty-four-year-old bachelor and live with my mother, Mrs. Rita V. Romero. I am requesting this loan since we need to install concrete flagstone for our house because we have a roof made of plates. As a result, when the weather is cold, our house is very cold. I work as an operator in a factory and my mother helps me in any way she can.

Jesús Rigoberto G. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola amigos de kiva, mi nombre es Jesús Rigoberto G. V. tengo 24 años soy soltero y vivo con mi mama la Sra. Rita V. Romero estoy solicitando este préstamo, ya que necesitamos poner una losa de concreto para nuestra casa porque tenemos techo de lamina, y en tiempo de frío nuestra casa es muy helada; trabajo como operador de una fabrica y mi mama me ayuda en lo que puede.”

loans.use: The installation of concrete flagstone

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo K., 50, is a farmer in Angk Village in Kandal Province. He has a lot of experience farming, and most of his rice revenue is very good. His wife, Mrs. Chon Lorn, combines the palm leaves together to process a thatch to sell. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study. In the household, Mr. Keo K. faces a small problem because his house does not have electricity. He always uses a battery to connect with his lamp in order to light in the household. Mr. Keo K. now does not want to use the old way because he spends a lot of money charging the battery, so he decided to ask for a loan to connect with the electricity in the local village to have light in the household.

loans.use: To connect with the electricity in the local village to have light in the household.

loans.name: J. Antonio

texts.es:
“Hello to the Kiva people that help other people. My name is J. Antonio H. González, I am retired and this is my house. Through this project I request a loan to be able to build a wall in front of my house and install a cement floor so that my wife and I may have more safety and comfort.”  Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer. 

“Hola gente de Kiva que se dedica ayudar a las demás personas, mi nombre es J. Antonio H. González soy pensionado y esta es mi casa, les pido por medio de este proyecto un préstamo para poder levantar una barda en el frente de mi casa y un piso de cemento para tener mas seguridad y comodidad  mi esposa y yo.”

loans.use: Build a wall and install a cement floor.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann S., a farmer in Vihea Village in Kandal Province, cultivates rice and vegetables in her field twice a year. Her husband, Mr. Kuon Kith, is a pig breeder. The problem Mrs. S. currently faces is an insufficient amount of money to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for her farming. Thus, she is requesting a loan for this purpose, with the remainder of the loan being used to purchase pesticides. 

Mrs. Yann S. is 42 years old and the mother of eight children, one of whom is a labourer who uses oxen to plow for a profit while five are attending school. The remaining two are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Yann S. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea P. and her husband, Mr. Poch Duch, are pig breeders in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. Since they currently breed ten pigs and their business is doing well, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to buy six more pigs for breeding. 

Mrs. P. is 64 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are married and live separately while the three others are tailors in the local village and make a small income that assist their parents' expenses.

loans.use: To buy six more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Alejandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Alejandra Lisseth M. R. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi.  Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. 

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.



“Hola mi nombre es Alejandra M. R., soy ama de casa, trabaja de una empresa comercial, soy casada y tengo 4 hijos, solicito este préstamo porque necesito una barda en la parte posterior  de mi casa ya que mis hijos juegan ahí, y me urge la seguridad en ellos también protecciones para las ventanas y vitropiso, porque la familia esta creciendo y queremos mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.”

loans.use: Construccion y protecciones en la vivienda.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha S., born in 1968, lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province where she is a Khmer noodle maker. Her husband, Mr. Each Orl, shown on the right in the photo, is a Tuk Tuk driver in Phnom Penh City. Unfortunately, Mrs. S.’s noodle machine is old and beyond repair, so she is requesting a loan to buy a new one for her business. 

Mrs. S. has seven children, one of whom is a driver for a company while another is a Khmer cake seller. Four others are enrolled in school while the youngest one is of preschool age.

loans.use: To buy a new noodle machine to make a good product to sell

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou C. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend school. She owns a small grocery store in the local village and her husband, Mr. Li Yorn, shown on the right of the photo, is a construction worker. 

Since Mr. Yom's workplace is so far from home and his transportation costs are so high, Mrs. C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to purchase a second hand motorbike for him to travel to work, thereby reducing household expenses.

loans.use: To help in the purchase of a second hand motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Peang

texts.en: Mrs. Peang S., a 53-year-old widow with a child employed in a garment factory, is a fruit seller in the local market in Lvea Sor Leu Village in Kandal Province. She previously obtained a loan to start her current business and has since fully repaid it. Because her business is doing well, Mrs. Peang S.  is now requesting a loan to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mr. Pok Y., 37, is a farmer and a veterinarian in Kor Village in Kandal Province.  He and his wife, Mrs. Prak Chan, have two children, both of whom attend school. Since Mr. Y. earns only a small income from farming due to the size of his rice field, he would like to expand it.  He is therefore requesting a loan to buy additional land upon which to cultivate rice and thereby increase his revenue.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice

loans.name: Soknat

texts.en:
Mrs. Soknat P., 24, is a farmer, and her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. She grows rice and has been farming since 1980, earning approximately $1 per day. Soknat has two children, all of whom are young and in school. They live in Trapeang Preah Commune in Kampong Cham Province.

Due to increasing family expenses, she needs to expand her business by raising pigs. And now she would like to request a loan to purchase piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To request a loan to purchase piglets and the rest amount purchase pig food

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes S. lives in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province where she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and resell later at a better price. Since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice. Her husband, Mr. Morm Rina, helps his wife’s business in order to improve their living conditions together. 

Mrs. Tes S. is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending school. The third child is yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for later resale

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith S., 25, the mother of two preschool-aged children, is a farmer and pig breeder in Takraong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Her husband, Mr. Tot Thy, sells firewood in the local village. Since his business is going well he wants to expand it, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy more firewood for him to resell. 

Previously, Mrs. S. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, from AMK to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her husband's business to resell.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy N., 47, is a farmer and the mother of two children who are attending school in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. So Mi, is a firewood seller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy a cart in order to transport firewood to sell door-to-door.  

Previously, Mrs. Tuy N. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport firewood to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This 46-year-old man is Abdul J..  He is married and lives in Ningarhar province with his family.  J. has 4 children who all go to school.  His brother works with him on their own agricultural lands and shares a house.  After his father died, J. became the responsible person for the household.

Besides farming, Abdul J. is actually a teacher.  He teaches in a public school in the morning, and in the afternoon he works as a farmer in his village.  He is growing different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the bazaar.   In addition, he has some livestock as well.  His small son brings grass for the animals.
 
J. is a hardworking man for sure, but there are 14 members in his family and supporting that many people with a 300 Afghanis ($6) a day income is almost impossible.  He, therefore, has to expand his business.  He thinks that if he buys more livestock and seed for his lands that he can increase his income.  He has asked AFSG for a 30,000 ($600) Afghanis loan.  He has decided to buy a cow and, with the remaining loan amount, purchase seeds and pesticides. 

Abdul J. dreams of the day that he solves all his economic problems and then concentrates on teaching.

loans.use: To buy livestock and seeds

loans.name: Sediq

texts.en:
Sediq U. is 33 and married, the father of one child who is about three years old. Sediq's family has been living for a long time in Shewa district of Ningarhar province, which is an agricultural area where Sediq, besides his teaching, works as a farmer on his own lands.

Sediq U. was married five years ago. Before the wedding, he worked only as a teacher in a public school in his village and his monthly salary of 3,000 Afghanis ($US60) was enough for him at the time. But, after his wedding,s his family expenses were going higher day by day and he felt that he could not meet them with this income. Therefore, he started farming in his spare time and after two years he was able to buy some stock also.

SediqU. is a hard-working man and, utilizing all his capabilities in his business, he increased his monthly income from $US60 to $US200. Now Sediq U. has a happy life, but he wants to work only at his teaching once again. So, he decided to recruit a worker to replace himself for his stock and farming. He plans to pay a monthly salary, but first he wants to buy more stock and agricultural seeds to pave the way completely for the new worker. There for he has requested a loan of $US1,075 loan from AFSG and promises to repay it in 24 months.

Sediq U. hopes to continue this business for a long time and recruit more workers. Also, he thanks honestly the lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy some stock and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is married to A. G. and lives in the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last eight years. She is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Saima baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her husband is a wholesaler and sells crockery. He has been in this profession for five years. Saima baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), which she used to buy more crockery. Now she is applying for another loan for the same business. Presently her husband sells crockery by going door to door, but in the future he hopes to buy a shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four others. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy ingredients such as yogurt and potatoes for her Punjabi food named "Dahi Bhala". Haleema baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more crockery inventory

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji is married to A. I. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last three years. She has no children. Her husband sells plastic bottles and earns profit. Farzana baji's father lives with her and has a milk business. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Farzana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her father's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, beads) for her embroidery business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Zaitoon baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams which are required for construction. Saima baji wants a loan to buy a machine for grind wheat.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a milk-production business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is married to S. M. and is a mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. She lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Kalsoom baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her elder son sells cigarettes. None of her children are getting education. Her husband has a business of livestock, buying and selling goats and cows. He has been in this profession for the last five years. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cattle to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. N. baji wants a loan to buy more garment inventory to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more sweetmeat to re-sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to re-sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy crockery to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a wife of M. and a mother of three sons. She lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Her eldest son makes embroidered dresses; her second son is a tailor, and her youngest son works in a factory. Her husband is a vegetable seller with five years of experience. Sakina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her second son, who is a tailor.

She is joined in her loan group by two others. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy supplies, such as ink and paper, for her printing business. Another Parveen baji wants a loan to buy crockery to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is married to A. R.. She lives in the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last two years. She has no children. Jamila baji is a housewife. Her husband is a salesman and sells spices. He buys spices from different shops and sells them in different markets. Presently he has no money to buy inventory. Therefore, Jamila baji is applying for a loan to buy spices to restart her husband's business.

Jamila is joined in her loan group by four others. Fatima baji and Ishrat baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Safia baji wants a loan to buy wheat to re-sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inentory

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 44 years old. She is married and she has 7 children aged between 3 and 16 years old. She has been selling charcoal and chicken since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Maryam is seeking a loan to buy more charcoal and chicken to resell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and chicken

loans.name: Subira's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Subira is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 2, 3 and 4. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 6 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Subira now requests a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaid and Anna, who also run businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sauhat

texts.en:
Sauhat is 29 years old. She is married. She has been selling charcoal and clothes since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Sauhat now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business

loans.name: Rehema's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old. She is married and she has 2 children aged 1 and 7. She has been an onion-seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more onions for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha and MwanaM., who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more onions for  re-sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 34 years old. She is married and has 5 children aged between 1 and 15. She has been selling clothes and soap since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4 PM at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and soap for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and soap for her business

loans.name: Mwatum's Imani Group

texts.en:
Mwatum is 50 years old. She is married and she has 4 children aged between 19 and 32 years old. She has been selling firewood and food items since 1988. Every day, she works at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwatum is requesting a loan to buy more firewood and food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Masheli.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and food items for her business

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin S., 42, is the leader of a small group, and sells fruit in the market. Her husband, Mr. Pheach Bora, is a bricklayer. Chin purchases her fruit from a local farmer. She has been selling fruit since 2005 and typically earns about $2.50 a day. Chin has six children, one of whom is married. Three of her children are bricklayers who can support her in her loan repayment. They all live in the Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.

Chin's fruit-selling business is growing, She wants to grow her business more, but faces obstacles of money, and now she would liK. to request a loan to achieve her purpose.

Her group members are listed here: Mrs. Sophan K., who is requesting a loan to purchase rice stock to maK. noodles to sell, and Mrs. Ny C., who is requesting a loan for Khmer caK.-making. She needs to purchase more ingredients such as rice, bananas, and potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Subira's Mkorofi Si Mwezi Group

texts.en:
Subira is 22 years old. She is married.

Subira has a business selling shoes and bed sheets. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Subira now hopes for a loan so she can buy more shoes and bed sheets to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Arafa, Mwanakhamis and Kidawa.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 18 years old. She is a single woman.

Zainab has been a food items seller since 2003. Each day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zainab now hopes for a loan so she can buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Layli

texts.en:
Layli M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children. Layli's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an independent taxi driver doesn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason that Layli decided to start her own business 10 years ago selling fabric for the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the ability to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally.

However, she would like to continue bettering herself (and her business) so her situation will be stable in the future, if something should happen. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) that she will pay back in 4 months. With this money, Layli will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married. She has 4 children, aged 14, 22, 26 and 28 years. She has a business selling spices and has been doing so since 2004. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more spices for her business.

loans.use: To buy more spices for her business.

loans.name: Zuhura's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is 30 years old. She is married and has 7 children who are between the ages of 4 and 15 years old.

Zuhura has had a business selling food since 2004. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zuhura now requests a loan so she can buy more food items like rice, maize, flour and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mgeni.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida is 25 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are 2, 3, and 5 years old.

Wahida has been a juice and soft drink seller since 2007. Each day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Wahida now requests a loan so she can buy more soft drinks and juice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Kazija's Mtasi Wa Masi Group

texts.en:
Kazija is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are ages 3 months, 3, 8 and 12 years.

Kazija has a business selling firewood and soap. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Kazija now seeks a loan to buy more firewood and soap for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mgeni and Biubwa.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and soap

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is 26 years old. She is married and has two children who are 1 and 5 years old.

Time became a food seller in 2008. Each day, she works at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Time now seeks a loan so she can buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Nunuu

texts.en:
Nunuu is married and has 6 children. Her children are between 4 and 18 years old.

Nunuu became a food seller in 2007. Each day, she works at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40.

Nunuu now requests a loan to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Yaeshi

texts.en:
Yaeshi is 36 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her children are 1, 5, 10 and 13 years old.

Yaeshi is a dress maker. She also has a business selling charcoal and firewood. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Yaeshi now hopes for a loan so she can buy more firewood and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Voeurt

texts.en:
Mr. Voeurt H., 33, purchases used goods to resell. Voeurt has a motorcycle with a basket so he can purchase used goods and resell to wholesalers. He typically earns $2.50 a day. He cares for his old father and one young nephew, who also runs a business. They live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

To increase income, Voeurt needs a loan to add to his capital to purchase more used goods for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods for resale

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Âàëèåâà Ñàëîìàò òîðãóåò ñ ñåñòðîé íà ðûíêå, íåäàâíî îíà âûøëà  çàìóæåì. Êîãäà îíà ñ ñåñòðîé áûëà åùå  ìàëåíüêîé,  åå ìàòü òîðãîâàëà äåòñêîé îäåæäîé, îíè âûõîäèë, è ïîìîãàëè åé íà ðûíêå. Г±ГЄГ®Г°ГҐ ГЁГµ Г¬ГіГ¦ГјГї ГіГҐГ¤ГіГІ Гў ГђГ®Г±ГЁГѕ Г­Г Г§Г Г°Г ГЎГ®ГІГЄГЁ ГЁ ГЁГ¬ ГЇГ°ГЁГ¤ГҐГІГ±Гї Г­ГҐГ±ГІГЁ Г¤Г®Г¬Г ГёГ­ГЁГҐ Г¤ГҐГ«Г Г±Г Г¬ГЁГ¬, ГЄГ®Г­ГҐГ·Г­Г® ГЁГµ Г¬ГіГ¦ГјГї ГЎГіГ¤ГіГІ ГЇГ°ГЁГ±Г»Г«Г ГІГј Г¤ГҐГ­ГјГЈГЁ, Г­Г® ГЅГІГ® ГЎГіГ¤ГҐГІ ГЁГ¤ГІГЁ Г­Г ГµГ®Г§ГїГ©Г±ГІГўГҐГ­Г­Г»ГҐ Г­ГіГ¦Г¤Г».

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Г¤Г«Гї Г°Г Г±ГёГЁГ°ГҐГ­ГЁГї

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Mrs. Proeung T., 21, is a farmer in the village of Thlork Roling in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Hoeun Kosal, is a firewood seller currently earning a small income to support his family, and since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by selling firewood door-to-door. Therefore, Mrs. Proeung T. is requesting a loan to buy a cart for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cart for her husband's business in order to sell firewood door-to-door.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Mrs. Hul C. is a firewood seller and pig breeder in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Tith Sophea, assists his wife’s businesses in order to help improve their living conditions. Since her first business is doing well, Mrs. C. wants to expand; therefore she is requesting a loan to buy more firewood to resell. 

Mrs. C. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is of preschool age.  She previously obtained a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Mrs. Peang R., 33, is a farmer in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and the mother of four children, three of whom attend school while the fourth assists Mrs. R.’s husband, Mr. Un Thy, in his firewood and pig-raising businesses. 

The problem facing Mrs. R. as a rice farmer is that she lacks sufficient funds to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. She is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose, with the rest  being used to purchase pesticides for the farm. Previously, she received a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng M. is a 43-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending school.  A clothing seller in the local market located in Mong Barang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Mrs.  M.  has already fully repaid the loan she received to start her current business. Since she wants to expand her enterprise, she is now requesting a new loan to acquire additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Trim

texts.en:
Mrs. Trim C., 36 years old and the mother of a preschool aged child, owns a small grocery store in the local market in Mong Barang Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Prach Bunthoeurn, shown on the left of the photo, is a motorbike taxi driver whose small income helps support the family. 

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. C. would like to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy additional grocery products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Mrs. Peang P. is a housewife in Khlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where her husband, Mr. Muong Meas, is a pot seller. Although she and her husband have business activities, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve those conditions, Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to start a cow breeding business. 

Mrs. P. is 40 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a pot maker while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Irene Mapuga's Azizi Group

texts.en:
Irene M., age 42, is married and has three children ages 23, 20 and 12. Since 1990, she has run a business selling drinks. She starts her workday at 10 a.m. at ends it at 10 p.m. on weekdays and 11 p.m. on weekends. She makes a monthly profit of about $280.

In the past, Irene has taken out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her supply of items to sell. She paid these loans back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to buy more drinks and more chairs. She will share these funds with her loan group, Azizi, which totals 16 members. These people hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Irene is the first person on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her supply of drinks and buy chairs

loans.name: Sophany's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophany K. Sophany is leader of five-member group, selling traditional Khmer cakes. She carries the cakes to customer's homes in her village Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been selling since 2006 and typically earns around $2 a day. She has four children, two of whom are married and two are construction workers. They live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

To expand business and increase income, Sophany would like to request a loan for her traditional cake-selling business, purchasing items such as rice, ingredients, and fruit.

Her group members follow: Mrs. Soeurn T., who is requesting a loan to use in her impure gold-selling business; Mr. Cheal Y., who is requesting a loan to use in her business selling sweets; Mrs. Savry H., who is requesting a loan to use for her second-hand clothes business; and Mr. Bunthoeun S., who is requesting a loan to use for selling cooked food. Mr. Bunthoeun is at the left side of the picture.

loans.use: For traditional cake selling business, purchasing such as rice, ingredients, and fruit

loans.name: Bizume

texts.en:
Bizume is married with 8 children aged between 2 and 18 years. She is a shoe and food items seller. She works at her businesses every day. Bizume can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Bizume now requests a loan so she can buy more shoes and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and food items for her business.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married. She has one child who is 2 years old.

Sharifa is a commodities seller. Each day, she works at her business selling goods. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Sharifa now hopes to receive a loan so she can buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra is 34 years old, married and has two children ages 7 and 2. She is currently in business selling cosmetics from a small shop which she opened five years ago. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, and is able to make a monthly profit of about $230.

In the past, Cleopatra took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and used it to increase her capital. She is applying for a new loan to buy clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with 4 children. Her children are 5, 9, 14 and 20 years old.

Mariam has a business selling fish and clothes. She has been in business since 1993. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan so she can buy more fish and clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish and clothes to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
23-year-old Riziki is married with a 5-year-old child. Since 2005, she has owned an art and craft shop where she works every day, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding more current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding more current stock.

loans.name: Seleman

texts.en: Seleman R. runs a small business selling phone accessories in the Buguruni business section of Dar-es-Salaam. He has three children, two in primary school and one in kindergarten. He would like to expand his shop, and has requested a loan of $550 to make that possible.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
29-year-old Mariam is married and has a 4-year-old child. Each day, she works at her food vending business, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with four children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 10. She own and runs a small general store where she works everyday. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business expansion.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida baji is the wife of M. and the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter.  She belongs to a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years.  Her sons are drivers by profession.  Her daughter is 16 years old and reads in 10th standard.  Abida baji's husband sells Punjabi snacks called "PAPAD".  He has been making the snacks for the past 15 years.  

Abida baji is a housewife, but she helps her husband by making the snacks.  Nowadays, her husband is out of stock.  Therefore, Abida baji is applying for a loan to buy materials (flour, cooking oil) to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell.  Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell.  Khalida baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.  Sugran baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making snacks

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana kosar baji is the wife of A. M. and a mother of one 10-year-old son, Husnain. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her husband runs a cigarette shop. He buys cigarettes from markets and sells them in his community. He has been in this profession for the last 8 years. Rehana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy more cigarettes to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy Islamic religious books for her bookshop. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy more wheat to resell. Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy rice and wheat to resell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy crockery for their food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cigarette inventory

loans.name: Chacheni

texts.en:
28-year-old Chacheni has been selling coconuts and oil since 2004. She works at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Chacheni now hopes for a loan to buy more coconuts and oil for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and oil for her business.

loans.name: Salma's Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
35-year-old Salma is married with five children, aged 18, 14, 7, 5 and 2. She is a firewood and spices seller. She works at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Salma now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and spices for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sabra.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and spices for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who has run her own shop for the last three years. She does business in a place known as Buguruni Mnyamani in Dar-es-Salaam. Halima sells a variety of items, including cereals, and uses her income to meet her family's expenses and pay her children's school fees. She wants to expand her business but money is tight, so she has requested a loan of $900 to make this possible.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Džidža

texts.en:
Džidža is a 34-year-old woman from Klokotnica, a small place near the town Doboj. Her husband is a demobilized soldier, and he provides construction services from time to time. When he works, he can earn about 800 KM monthly. They have two children who go to the primary school.

Džidža asked for loan in the amount of 1000 KM, and this is her second loan at WWI. Her intent is to buy chickens for breeding and crates for fruits, because she has 50 trees of different fruits. Growing fruit is something new that Ð is interested in, and she thinks that she has a good opportunity to expand business with fruit. She will use these crates to bring fruit to the market and to sell it to small shops in the region. She has been doing poultry for a long time with pauses in the summer, and now she wants to buy chickens for the winter because she doesn't have fruit to work with during the winter.

loans.use: To buy chickens and crates

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman with 4 children between 8 and 25 years old. Her husband is a self-employed ceramic engineer. When he works, he can earn about 1200 KM, but in the period when he doesn't work, they spend their savings. Fatima will use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM to buy chicken for fattening. Fatima had done this work before, and she wants to keep doing it during the winter. Fatima will use part of the loan to build a brick hen house because she has one made of wood. She wants to ensure good conditions for chicken breeding.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Juma Sadik's Songambele Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Juma, age 36, is married with four children ages 9, 7, 4 and 2 weeks. He owns a general store where he sells products such as food and cosmetics. He opened the store six years ago and works daily from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. With his store, he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $430.

In the past, Juma has taken out four loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to build a home for his children and buy more items to sell to his customers. He has paid the loans back successfully, and now hopes for a new loan to increase the size of his shop. He will share this loan with the members of group, which has 17 people in it. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Juma is standing in the last row, second from the right.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba M. is a Tanzanian businesswoman who runs two companies in the Buguruni area of Dar-es-Salaam --- a charcoal store and a café. Her businesses are three years old.  She purchases charcoal bags wholesale and sells them retail to customers. Demand for charcoal is high because it is the main source of power in developing countries such as Tanzania. Habiba opened her café in an effort to diversify her sources of income, and has applied for a loan of a loan of $730 to buy more supplies to meet the demand for her products.

loans.use: To expand her businesses

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a widow and she lives alone in Klokotnica near the town Gračanica. She is 63 years old and receives a pension in the amount of 540 KM. She has one cow, and she can earn 200 KM more by selling milk and milk products. Hana asked for her second loan at WWI in the amount of 1000 KM in order to buy hay and vaccines for the cow. Hana is very happy because she has this cow. She spends a lot of free time with the cow, and she wants to ensure that her cow is healthy and satisfied during the winter.

loans.use: To buy hay and vaccines

loans.name: Suvada

texts.en: Suvada is 36 years old. She is married and living in Klokotnica near the town Doboj. She has two children. Her husband is self-employed in agriculture. He has his own machines which he uses to do anything agricultural for his clients. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM.  In her current business she raises sheep. She plans to use this loan to buy vaccines for the sheep because she already has 20 sheep.  Her future goal is to expand the number of sheep and to protect them from diseases, and she hopes that she will manage it with these vaccines.

loans.use: To buy vaccines

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija A. is a Tanzanian businesswoman who makes a living selling traditional clothing known locA. as Kanga and Vitenge. She buys wholesale and sells to her customers in a local shopping center and in the Buguruni business market. Her dream is to open and run a real store. She requests a loan of  $325 to buy new supplies and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vanesa
