texts.en: Vanesa was born in 1989. She is married, and her husband has a full-time job with a monthly salary of 500 KM. They don't have any children. This is Vanesa's first loan, and she requested 1000 KM. Her intent is to buy a cow which costs 2100 KM. She has some saved money, and she thinks that this loan would be a great help for her and her husband. Her wish is to improve her household income by selling milk to the local dairy.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida is a 62-year-old woman from Doborovci, near the town Gračanica. She is a widow, and she lives with her son who works. She receives a pension in the amount of 380 KM. This is her sixth loan in WWI, and this loan amount is 500 KM. Ferida will use it to buy one more cow, because she already has one. Her wish is to produce more milk products that she will sell to earn more money for herself and her son.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Fatma's Tuwe Sote 1 Group

texts.en:
Fatma, 40 years old, is married and has a 19-year-old child. She has been selling charcoal and coconuts since 2006. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma and Mkasi.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
30-year-old Zawadi has been selling charcoal and firewood since 2005. She works from 7am to 8pm at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zawadi now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Indira

texts.en: Indira is 25 years old. She is not married and lives alone in a small place called Miričina, near the town Gračanica. She works in a shoe factory and her salary amounts to 450 KM. That is her full time job. This is her first loan in the amount of 1500 KM, and she will use it to purchase more cosmetics at wholesale to sell at retail. She earns additional money with this cosmetic business, and her intent is to save the money for the future and use it in cases when she will need it.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Karim's Group

texts.en:
Karim baji lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. Karim baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is a mason. Her husband, A. H., has worked in the fruit business for the last 10 years and earns $26 per month. Karim baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more paints for her paint shop. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy tractor. Razia baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to re-sell. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruit inventory

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena baji is a wife of M. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her husband is a wholesaler; he buys fertilizer and corn from the wholesale market and sells them in different cities. Meena baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizer and corn to expand her husband's business on a larger scale.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy raw sugar to re-sell. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy fruit to re-sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy paint for her paint shop. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy inventory for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and corn to sell retail

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Naziran baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her husband is a vegetable seller and operates his business with his brother. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Naziran baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a two others. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy spare parts of vehicles for her spare parts shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra was born in 1972. She works as a house mate and earns about 300 KM monthly. Her husband has a full time job and earns about 600 KM. They don't have any additional income. They have one son who goes to the primary school. This is her second loan at WWI, and it amounts to 1500 KM. She wants to repair a car that she needs for her job. Her wish is to buy a vacuum cleaner in order to improve the services she offers and find more costumers.

loans.use: To repair a car.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Kituzwacho Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Mwajuma is married with three children, aged 11, 8 and 6. She has been a clothes and bites (snacks) seller since 2004. She works at her business every day and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwajuma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and other items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Njema.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other items for her business.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is married to M. A. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last four years. She has one son who is just 9 months old. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and is a painter by profession, painting houses, windows, doors, etc. Her husband runs a grocery shop and has six years of experience. Bashiran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Bashiran baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy more groceries to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by two others. Safia baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw, a local three-wheeled motor vehicle.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Jokha

texts.en:
Jokha is 36 years old and married. She has been selling clothes and bites (chapati) since 2005. Each day, she works at her business, earning a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Jokha is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Surgran baji is married to K. M. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 10 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. Her eldest son sells garments in different markets, while her second son sells cosmetics. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Sugran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her son. Her son wants to expand his cosmetics business and wishes to buy a shop in a big market where he sells his cosmetic products.

She is joined in her loan group by four others. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy paints for her paint shop. Naziran baji and Shamshad baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine. Saima baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a cosmetics business

loans.name: Šaha

texts.en: Šaha is from Miričina, a small place near the town Gračanica. She is 46 years old and has two sons who are going to the primary school.  Šaha sells poultry, and she can earn about 250 KM monthly. She will use this loan in the amount of 1500 KM to buy more chickens for fattening. Her wish is to expand the business with chickens and to extend the hen house. This has been her wish for a long time.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Asha is married with three children, aged 13, 6 and 3. She has been selling perfume and shoes since 2002. She works at her business every day, earning a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more perfume and shoes to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes amd shoe to increase her stock

loans.name: Selwa's Twende Na Wakati Group

texts.en:
Selwa is 28 years old and married with a four-year-old child. She has been a juice and bites (snacks) seller since 2005. She works at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Selwa is now requesting a loan to increase her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loans.use: To increase current stock

loans.name: Uljonoy

texts.ru:
Алиева Улжоной родилась в 1962 году. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Одна из самых преуспевающих микропредпринимателей в районе Рудаки. Благодаря разборчивости в тканях женской национальной одежды и ее 10-летниму опыту в этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов.  Она торгует тканями широкого ассортимента и для любого сезона.  Закупает свой товар с Бишкека и продает в местном рынке «Сафина».  У нее можно купить не только самые модные ткани для шикарного мероприятия и  для деловых встреч, но и можно найти легкие ткани из хлопка для повседневной носки.  
Улжоной очень хотелось бы еще закупить ткани производства Дубай и таким образом  увеличить оборотный капитал. Для этого она хочет получить займ  в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на год.
texts.en:
Uljonoy A. was born in 1962. She is married, with three children. She is one of the most successful entrepreneurs in the Rudaki district. Thanks to her knowledge of traditional women’s fabrics and her 10 year experience in this business, Uljonoy gained trust among many of her clients. She sells a wide array of fabrics, good for any season. She purchases her goods from Bishkek and sells them at a local market, Safin. Not only can one purchase fabrics from Uljonoy for a glamorous occasion and business meetings, but also light cotton fabrics for everyday wear. Uljonoy would like to purchase fabrics made in Dubai in order to increase her capital flow. She wants to obtain a 12 month $1200 loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Mwamvita

texts.en:
Mwamvita is 36 years old and married. She has an 15-year-old child. Since 2005, she has been running her own salon where she works daily, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwamvita now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 25 years old and married. Since 2004, she has worked at her own small general store where she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zena now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Arnaldo Z. is 48 years old and married to Ms. Julia Ramirez, 40 years old. They hae 8 children, who live with them and are students.

Arnaldo, who was in search of work traveled to Argentina, where he spend a good deal of time working and with a small amount of savings, he was able to return to our country in approximately 2002. He decided to invest in the purchase of tools and materials to work as an ironworker, making chairs made of metal and cables (in Paraguay metal and colored cable chairs, which are usually used in the garden, are very popular) and other iron works.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase more materials such as; cables, pipes, gas, oxigen and others, taking into account that materials are expensive and that he need them in large quantities.

He is confident that if one works with dedication, effort and determination one will progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Arnaldo Z. de 48 años de edad, esta casado con la señora. Julia Ramírez de 40 años, la pareja tienen 8 hijos todos viven con ellos, todos están estudiando.

Don Arnaldo que en busca de trabajo viajó a la Argentina, donde paso un buen tiempo trabajando y con un pequeño ahorro volvió a nuestro país aproximadamente en el año 2.000, y decidió invertir en la compra de herramientas y materiales para realizar trabajos de herrería, fabricar sillones de metal y de cables (en Paraguay son muy populares los sillones hechos de cables de colores que generalmente se usan en el jardín) entre otros.

La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas materiales tales como: cordones, caños, gas, oxígeno y otros, teniendo en cuenta que los materiales son caros y el lo necesita en grandes cantidades.

El confía que si trabajamos con mucho esfuerzo, empeño y dedicación progresaremos.

loans.use: Buy materials such as: cables, tubing, gas, and oxygen.

loans.name: Djuma

texts.ru:
Джобаров Джума 1958 года рождения, женат, отец пятерых детей. Занимается продажей обуви уже 5 лет. Местом деятельности Джумы является  рынок «Сафина» в районе Рудаки.  Он товары закупает на рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Китая. 
Ассортимент продаваемых его товаров очень разнообразен. От самых элегантных  туфель для выхода до спортивных для любого возраста. Качественные и удобные обуви всегда в моде и этого он хорошо знает. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви Джума хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Djuma D., born in 1958, is married and has five children. He has been in the business of shoe sales for 5 years. His retail outlet is located at the Safin market in the Rudaki district. Djuma buys his goods at the Korvon market and sometimes from China. His wide goods assortment ranges from elegant dress shoes to athletic shoes for any age. Djuma knows well that quality and comfort shoes are always in style. During the fall sale season, Djuma wants to participate in the Kiva program and obtain an 8 month $1025 loan in order to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
39-year-old Riziki has been selling bedsheets and juice since 2002. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki now requests a loan to buy more bedsheets and juice for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and juice for her business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy B. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce de crème glacée, activité très rentable en cette période de forte chaleur. Elle envisage en même temps d’acheter et de revendre des tissus teintés « thioup ». Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Amy B. is married and the mother of six children, plus two others, in her care. She would like to bolster her small ice cream business, which is very profitable during this period of high heat. She envisions at the same time buying and reselling dyed "thioup" cloth. She intends to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure the right schooling. She is going to repay the loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou F. est une femme âgée de 54 ans et mariée. Elle souhaite un prêt qui lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux (mangues). Cette activité lui permettra d’avoir les moyens d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Bintou F. is 54-year-old woman and is married. She would like a loan that will enable her to bolster her small business involving local fruit (mangoes). This work will allow her the means to improve her children's living conditions. She is going to repay the loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell local seasonal fruit (mangoes)

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
48-year-old Mwanaisha is married, and has one child who is 30 years old. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her own general store where she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanaisha now seeks a loan to buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.fr: Cathy (Katy) N. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de fruits locaux (mangues et pastèques). Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout d’assurer une scolarité et une vie saine à ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Cathy (Katy) N. is married and the mother of six children, plus two others, in her care. She would like a loan to bolster her work selling local fruit (mangoes and watermelons). This will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and especially to ensure an education and a healthy life for her children. She is going to repay this loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell local fruit (mangoes, watermelon) in season

loans.name: Elizabeth Alphonce's Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth A., age 22, is the single mother of an 8-year-old boy. She has two businesses that she started in 2003, one selling clothes and the other selling powdered soap to her customers door-to-door. She works from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and earns a monthly profit of about $41 from selling powdered soap and $51 from selling clothes.

The loan she hopes to receive now will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back the first three successfully and used them to build a two-room house and increase her inventory of items for sale. She will use half of the funds from this new loan to build a bathroom and the other half to import more supplies from Zanzibar to Dar es Salaam (including bags) to sell. She will share this loan with her group, which totals 15 members. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is in the front center wearing a blue and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to increase the number of items she has for sale and to repair the bathroom in her home

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru:
Зухурова Зумрат родилась 1975 году. Она замужем, имеет 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, совою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала 2 года назад с продажи женской и детской обуви на рынке «Ганчина» города Душанбе. Позже набрав опыта и средств арендовала Дилерский Центр по продаже телефонных карт. Свой товар - телефонные карты Зумрат закупает от Сотовых компаний по договоренности. В данный момент у нее все наименования карт таких сотовых компаний как «Indigo», «Biline», «Babilone», «MLT», «M-Teko», «TK-Mobile», и «Somoncom». 
В дальнейшем хочет открыть еще один Дилерский центр и с помощью займа в сумме 4000 сомони хочет осуществить эту мечту.
texts.en:
Zumrat Z. was born in 1957. She is married and has 2 children. She has a higher education and started her entrepreneurship 2 years ago, selling women and kids shoes at the Ganchin market in Dushanbe. Later, as she gained experience and means, Zumrat rented a dealer center to sell phone cards. She buys phone cards wholesale from cellular companies. Currently, she has all types of cards from such cellular companies as Indigo, Biline, Babilone, MLT, M-Teko, TK-Mobile and Somoncom. Zumrat would like to open another dealer center and feels that a $1175 loan will help her achieve this dream.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Sada's Tujitahid Group

texts.en:
Sada is married with one child who is three years old. She runs a small food shop. Every day, she works from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Sada now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as sugar, salt, juice, rice, and maize flour for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with food vending, fish sales, firewood and charcoal sales, and salon ownership.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock

loans.name: Siti's Tujitahidi Group

texts.en:
Siti is a widow with two children, ages 3 and 1. She is a fish seller. Every day, she works from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Siti now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Nasra, who also have businesses dealing with firewood sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Alena

texts.en: Alena is a married woman from Te anj.  At the market, together with her husband, she sells textiles and clothes during the weekend. They can earn 1000 KM per month if the season is good. During the week, she works in a leather factory and receives a monthly salary in the amount of 500 KM. They have two children and this is her first loan at WWI in the amount of 1200 KM. She needs this loan because she wants to buy fruit seeds for sowing. She wants to plant more fruit tree in her small orchard.

loans.use: To buy fruit seeds.

loans.name: Nihada

texts.en: Nihada lives in the town Te anj and she is not married. She asked for a loan in the amount of 1200 KM in order to buy a sewing machine. She works in a leather factory as a seamstress, and she wants to use her knowledge. She will buy a sewing machine and do tailoring at home. In that way, she can earn additional money and help support her parents and their household.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D., 67 ans est mariée et mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce en détail de produits alimentaires locaux. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>voici son premier prêt qu’elle compte rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Coumba D., age 67, is married and the mother of seven children, plus two others, in her care. She would like to bolster her small retail business involving local food products. She wants to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure the right schooling for them. This is her first loan that she intends to repay all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various local food products

loans.name: Muhbirahon

texts.ru: Нозирова Мухбирахон молодая женщина, ей 33 лет, замужем, занимается продажей сухофруктов. У нее высшее образование.  В 2004 году начала заниматься бизнесом. Она продает сухофруктов в большом ассортименте: сушенные абрикосы, изюм, грецкие орехи, миндаль, фисташки и т.д. Местом деятельности  Мухбирахона является рынок «Саховат» города Душанбе а закупает товар у дехкан и поставщиков из Худжанда. Скоро наступает пост в связи с «Уразой» и в этот период наблюдается большой спрос на сухофрукты. Недавно она узнала от своих подруг, что многие бизнесмены увеличивают свой товарооборот с помощью кредитов. С этой целью она решила получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа товара и увеличения своего товарооборота.
texts.en:
Muhbirahon N. is a young woman, 33 years old, married, and is involved with the selling of dried fruits. She has a college education. In 2004 she began to be involved in this type of business. She sells dried fruit in a large assortment:dried apricots, raisins, Greek walnuts, almonds, pistachios etc. She sells her products at a local market (Caxovat) in the city of Dyshanbi, and she buys the products in bulk from whole sale suppliers from Xydzhanda. Soon there will be a post with connections to Yrazoi, and at this time there is a high demand for dried fruit. Recently she has heard from her friends that a lot of businesses increase commodity-circulation with the help of loans.Therefore with this goal in mind, she has made the decision to receive a loan in the sum of $12,000 to buy products in bulk and increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried fruits

loans.name: Serigne Diop

texts.fr: Serigne Diop K. est un coordonnier  qui a une expérience de 20ans (depuis son enfance. Marié et  père de 2 enfants  il veut ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses fabrications de chaussures et de ceintures qui sont très sollicitées par sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Serigne Diop K. is a shoemaker with 20 years’ experience (going back to his childhood). Married and the father of two children, he wants this loan to strengthen his business and step up his manufacture of shoes and belts, which are highly demanded by his customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for the manufacture of shoes and belts

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Рахимкулова Латофат  1962 года рождения. Она разведена и у нее четверо детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала еще 8 лет назад с продажи кондитерских изделий. В данный момент у нее большой ассортимент товаров. Она   торгует конфетами и кондитерскими изделиями производства России и Турции на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. Также у нее имеется продукты отечественного производства.  Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда. Для увеличения оборотного капитала она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на год.
texts.en:
Latofat R. was born in 1962. She is divorced and has four children. Her enterprise activity that she began 8 years ago sells confectionery products. At the present time it has a big assortment of goods. She trades sweets and confectionery products manufactured in Russia and Turkey in the market "Саховат " in the city of Dushanbe. She also has products of domestic production. She buys her goods in wholesale shops in "Safar-center" in the cities of Dushanbe and from wholesalers from the city of Khudzha. For her to increase capital she wants to receive a loan in the sum of $1200 for the duration of a year.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different sweets

loans.name: Baye Ndiaye

texts.fr: mr baye ndiaye S. est un habitant du quarier keur serigne ablaye à thies né le 01/01/01971 .il est marié et père de deux enfants.il a un magasin près du marché de thiès et son activité consiste à faire des poses d'ongles artificiels pour les femmes .il fait ce métier depuis presque trois ans et y tire l'essentiel de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Baye Ndiaye S. is a resident of the Keur Serigne Ablaye neighborhood of Thiès. He was born on January 1, 1971. He is married and the father of two children. He has a store near the market in Thiès and his business consists of applying false nails to women. He has been doing this for almost three years and makes most of his income from it.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for applying false nails

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Diatou D., 43 ans est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle souhaite un prêt pour renforcer son capital de commerce de tissus teints « Thioup », de tissus « Wax » et en même temps de bijoux de moindre qualité. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarisation de ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Diatou D., age 43, is married and the mother of eight children. She would like a loan to bolster her business capital for dyed "thioup" cloth, "Wax" fabrics, and at the same time, semi-precious gems or jewelry. This business will enable her to improve her living conditions in terms of health and schooling for her children. She is going to repay this loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by and resell dyed "thioup" cloth, gems, and "Wax" fabrics

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a teenage daughter. She owns a small business selling leather purses in one of the local markets in Melitopol. Marina has been in this business for the last 7 years. Presently, she has about US$ 6000 in inventory. Her gross income is about US$ 2000.

Marina is hoping to continue developing her enterprise and increase her income. She is an experienced entrepreneur who also has a flexible discount system for loyal low-income customers. This time she is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase her stock. The already busy markets get even busier as many shoppers get out to buy things for fall. Marina would like to be able to maintain an adequate product inventory during this time so that this will be a profitable season for her and her small business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla has a grown son who is 25, and they live in Melitopol. Alla supports her small family selling groceries in the central city market of her home town. She has been in the trade for 5 years already, and her monthly profit is about $400. 

Alla is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to continue growing her business. The approaching fall season means increased buyer activity. Alla recognizes this as a good opportunity to broaden the selection of goods she offers and increase her sales volume. She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of groceries, which will increase her available inventory. Alla is known as an open and lively woman who cares about her customers' needs. As she provides for the needs of others, she will be able to generate the necessary funds to adequately provide for herself and her son.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Alejandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Alejandra M. R. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

“Hello, my name is Alejandra M. R.. I am a married mother of 4 children, and I work in a company as a cashier. I am requesting this loan because I need to construct a protective wall and install security bars in the backyard of my home since that is where my children play. My husband and I work hard everyday in order to provide our children with more safety and above all, offer them a better quality of life. We know that the country’s financial situation is currently very difficult, so we need to work a great deal in order to live with dignity.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola mi nombre es Alejandra M. R., trabajo de una empresa comercial como cajera soy casada y tengo 4 hijos, solicito este préstamo porque necesito una barda en la parte posterior de mi casa y poner protecciones ya que mis hijos juegan ahí, mi esposo y yo nos esforzamos cada dia por darles mas seguridad y sobre todo mejor calidad de vida, sabemos que la situacion economica es muy dificil en estos tiempos asi es que hay que trabajar mucho para vivir mas dignamente ¨

loans.use: Construct protective wall and security bars

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Hello friends. My name is Sandra Luz G. V.. The loan I am requesting is for the purchase of tools and used clothing because I buy and sell clothing, footwear, and tools in order to earn money to pay for the family expenses and take care of my 5 children. My business is called “El Milagrito” (The Little Miracle) because it has been established after much effort. I like to work hard in order to move ahead and show my children how to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola amigos, mi nombre es Sandra Luz G. V., el préstamo que requiero es para la compra de un lote de herramientas y ropa usada ya que yo me dedico a la compra-venta de ropa, calzado, herramientas y así es como me gano el dinero para los gastos de mi familia ya que tengo 5 hijos, mi negocio se llama ¨El Milagrito¨ porque a base de esfuerzos se ha logrado, a mi me gusta luchar para salir adelante y enseñarles a mis hijos a ser personas de bien.”

loans.use: Purchase used tools and clothing

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe Esmera

texts.es:
Hello Kiva friends. My name is Ana Guadalupe Esmeralda P. G.. I have been running a food take-out business for a year called “Laborisnak.” I have one son and this is our family business. I am asking for assistance in order to purchase the ingredients needed to make other types of meals and vary my menu, thus increasing both my clientele and my income so that I can provide my family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola amigos de KIVA ,mi nombre es Ana Guadalupe. Esmeralda P. G. tengo un negocio de comidas para llevar, desde hace 1 año se llama ¨Laborisnak¨, tengo un hijo y este es el negocio de la familia la ayuda que les estoy pidiendo es para comprar ingredientes para hacer otro tipo de comida en mi negocio algo mas variada , para así poder tener mas clientes y por lo tanto mas ingresos y darle a mi familia una mejor calidad de vida.”

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make more meals

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia started the business because she likes sewing. Wanting to occupy her free time, she learned how to make clothing. She started 10 years ago, when a family member asked her to make a dress. From then on, she began to make clothing for other people, which has given her good profits.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase fabric and have enough supplies available to take advantage of the school uniform season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia inició el negocio porque le gusta la costura y para ocupar su tiempo libre aprendió a confeccionar prendas D. vestir. Comenzó hace diez años cuando le pidieron que hiciera un vestido a un familiar y D. ahí empezó a confeccionar prendas D. vestir a más gente, lo que le ha dado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar telas y aprovechar la temporada D. uniformes escolares y tener materia prima disponible.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene started her own business after her divorce because the family income diminished, so she needed to find a way to cover the household expenses and raise her 3 children. She started out in 1997 working at a relative’s restaurant. In 2000, she decided to set up her own stand to sell gorditas (small, thick, corn flour tortillas), and her daughters started to help her prepare the stews and serve the customers in their spare time.

She needs a loan of $600.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to remodel the business space with paint and furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene inició el negocio cuando se divorcio, los ingresos familiares disminuyeron, y tuvo que buscar la forma de solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus 3 hijos, comenzó en 1997, trabajando como empleada familiar en un negocio de comida de un familiar. En el 2000, se decidió a poner su puesto de gorditas y sus hijas empezaron a trabajar y en su horario libre le ayudan con los guisos y en atención a clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local con pintura y compra mobiliario.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 42 years old. She is married with five kids. Currently, Vida supports all her kids in school. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice balls and "banku". Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production costs. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Vida is a member of a group called 'Nyame do' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Henriete Eugenia

texts.es:
Mrs. Henriete Eugenia H. H. is a native of the city of Bluefields, is 59 years old, and is a single mother of 9 dependent children.  Mrs. H. has been the owner of a small grocery store for more than 5 years, having a clients the residents of her neighborhood who prefer her for the variety of products that she offers (basic grains, juices, soups, sodas, and natural refreshments among other things).  This business is her only income.  It should be emphasized that the demand for the products that she sells has not diminished since they are widely consumed by the population.  Mrs. H. needs to buy:  one 100 lb sack of rice at US$62.00 per sack, one 100 lb. sack of sugar at US$32.00 per sack, one jug of oil at US$46.00 per jug, three cases of laundry soap at US$12.00 per case, three bags of toilet paper at US$10.00 per bag, two cases of coffee at US$27.00 per case, and three cases of powdered milk at US$25.00 per case.  With this investment she will increase her earnings and will be able to satisfy her clients’ needs.

 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Henriete Eugenia H. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 59 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 9 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. H. es propietaria de una pulpería por más de 5  años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas), siendo este negocio su único ingreso, cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. La Sra. H. necesita comprar: 1 quintal de arroz a $ 62.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintales de azúcar a  $ 32.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidones de aceite a $ 46.00 dólares el bidón, 3 cajas de Jabón para  lavar ropa a $ 12.00 dólares cada  caja, 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 10.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de café a $ 27.00 dólares cada caja,  3 caja de leche en polvo a $ 25 .00 dólares la caja, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, soap, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper

payments.comment: Esta pagando las cuotas numeros 01 y 02.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia started her business in order to earn enough income to pay for her expenses because she was unable to find a job. Since she has always liked retail, she decided to start selling denim apparel three years ago in the street markets. Her business is currently prosperous.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a protective structure for the denim stand that she has in the market, thus allowing her to protect herself from inclement weather.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yesenia inició el negocio para tener una actividad que le diera un ingreso para pagar sus gastos por que no conseguía trabajo y como siempre le han gustado las ventas decidió hace tres años empezar a vender ropa de mezclilla en los tianguis ropa y actualmente le va bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estructura para el puesto de ropa que tiene en los mercados y así poder protegerse de las inclemencias del tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase protective structure

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela started this business because she enjoys sales and presenting merchandise to her clients. Thanks to her work she knows many people. She was looking for an productive activity that would help here achieve economic solvency. It started about 2 years ago in a presentation of perfume sales, she found it interesting and so decided to start her business.

She needs a loan of US $250, that will be repaid in 6 months, in order to acquire perfumes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maricela qué inició el negocio porque le gustan a las ventas y las demostraciones con sus clientes ya que en este trabajo conoce a muchas personas. Ella buscaba tener una actividad productiva que le ayudara a tener solvencia económica, comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años en una demostración de venta de perfumes entonces le intereso esta actividad y decidido dedicarse a esto.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir perfumes y así subir sus ventas.

loans.use: To acquire perfumes

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is a 28-year-old man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He is an agrochemical seller and sells herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his business because it is now the season during which most farmers are actively planting their crops. He wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies to serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to earn enough money to sponsor his kids' education.  Kwadwo is a member of a group called 'Nyame do' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Martha started this endeavor because she wanted to have her own retail business, since she enjoys sales, in addition to creating a way to sustain her family as she cares for her parents. She started about 3 years ago and opened her clothing store with the intention of earning income, and little by little it has begun to grow.

She needs a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase clothes and improve their sales.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Martha inició el negocio para tener un negocio propio ya que le gustan las ventas además de tener una forma de mantener a su familia ya que sus padres dependen de ella. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años puso su tienda de ropa con la finalidad de tener ingresos y poco a poco la ha hecho crecer.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir ropa y subir sus ventas.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of sheets

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel started her business when someone brought her packages of used toys from the United States that she offered for sale. It went well, and so she started buying and selling toys out of her home 2 years ago. Now, she also sells her wares in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for $250, that she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel inició el negocio ya que una persona que trae pacas de juguetes usados de estados unidos le ofreció para vender y le pareció bien, así comenzó hace 2 años, compro una paca de juguetes, y los vendía afuera de su casa, ahora va a los tianguis a vender también.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa started her business because she needed money to help her husband with the costs of raising their 2 small children of 10 and 2 years old. She started her business 14 years ago, when she borrowed money from a friend and contacted a person from the US that brought packages of used clothing which she then started to sell from her home, and later in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise because the type of clothing she sells is very popular.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa inició el negocio porque necesitaba dinero para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 2 años. Comenzó hace 14 años, cuando pidió prestado dinero a una comadre y ella le dio el dato de una persona que traía pacas de ropa usada de estados unidos. Empezó a vender en su casa y después en los tianguis.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía porque ese tipo de ropa la piden mucho.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia D. is 32 years old. She is married with three kids and lives at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with her family. She sells cooked eggs with pepper in her neighborhood. She balances her stock of eggs on her head and moves around to sell them. She says that over the last few months, the price of eggs has almost doubled. With the loan, she wants to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes to earn more money to support her kids in school. Lydia is a member of a group called 'Francis Trust Group'. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria started her business because when she married her husband there were no general stores near their home. Presented with the need for income, she started her business 5 years ago, selling sweets from her home. Later, she added general goods, and little by little her business has grown.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and restock her general store.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maria inició el negocio porque cuando se caso con su esposo, cerca de su casa no había ninguna tienda de abarrotes y ante la necesidad de tener ingresos comenzó hace 5 años, vendiendo dulces en la puerta de su casa, y después empezó a vender abarrotes, poco a poco logro hacer crecer su tienda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y resurtir la tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bale of women’s assorted clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A., 49 years old, is a wife and mother of three kids who are currently in school.  She operates a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, clothes, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags for the past eight years.  

Agnes is constrained by funds to run the business.  She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.  She believes the loan will help her to have more resources to purchase good quality and large quantities to upgrade her inventory.  She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa started her business after her husband left her. He went to the US and she needed money to raise her 2 children. She started working 4 years ago; a friend recommended that she sell cosmetics out of a catalog which she bought and started to sell among acquaintances, which has permitted her to earn an income and move forward.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be rapid in 6 months, to purchase merchandise for sales.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio ya que su esposo la abandono, se fue a estados unidos y necesitaba dinero para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Comenzó hace 4 años, una amiga le recomendó que vendiera cosméticos por catalogo, lo compre y empezó a vender entre sus conocidas lo que le ha permitido tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Roxana Gorety

texts.es:
Roxana started her business because her husband's income alone wasn't enough to provide for their children. Five years ago Roxana borrowed money from her aunt to start her clothing business, bringing clothes to Moroleón to sell to family and friends. Later she found more customers through her children's school. Little by little Roxana has grown her business.

Roxana needs a loan of $650, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the funds to buy school clothes and seasonal clothes. With your help Roxana can achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana inició el negocio porque no completaban con el ingreso de su esposo, para los gastos de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 5 años, le presto dinero una tía y fue a traer ropa a México, Moroleón, para vender, comenzó vendiéndoles a familiares y amigos, después se hizo de más clientes en la escuela de sus hijos, y poco a poco ha mantenido su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir calzado escolar y ropa de temporada, con tu ayuda podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is married and has four children. Her children are 16, 19, 21, and 24, respectively, and the older three are married. Cristina's husband works as an agent. Cristina has always liked working in sales, so two years ago she started a perfume business. She sells perfumes to her family, friends, and neighbors. All of her sales are on credit, and sometimes her clients are late on payments. This has led Cristina to give preference to clients who can secure payment.

Cristina needs a loan of $650, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the money to build her inventory of perfumes and to fill the orders that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es casada y madre de 4 hijos de 16, 19 21 y 24 años (los tres mayores ya casados), su esposo trabaja como comisionista. Ella inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado y se ha dedicado a las ventas, comenzó hace mas de 2 años, tenia un dinero ahorrado y empezó vendiendo perfumes a familiares, amigos y vecinos, todas sus ventas son en pagos, en ocasiones le quedan mal, aun que siempre le pagan pero esto ocasiona que ella se retrace en surtir otros pedidos seguros que tiene.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para tener inventario extra de perfumes y poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Francisco José B. is a native of the city of Bluefields, is 49 years old, is married to Mrs. María del Socorro Urbina,  and together they have 3 children.  The only income that the entrepreneur has is that of his business.  Mr. B. has been a distributor of basic food staples and dairy products for 11 years.  He offers beans, cheese, and yuca and malanga root, among other things, having as clients owners of general stores that prefer him because he offers a variety of products.  This is the second loan for this small business entrepreneur.  It should be noted that the demand for the products that he sells has not diminished since they are widely consumed by the population.  Right now he needs to buy:  five 100 lb. bags of beans at US$50.00 per bag, and three 100 lb. blocks of cheese at US$120.00 per block.  With this investment, he will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of his clients.

 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El  Microempresario  Francisco José B. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tienen 49 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. María del Socorro Urbina, ambos tienen 3 hijos. El único ingreso que tiene el  microempresario es el de su negocio. El  Sr. B. es distribuidor de productos básicos  y lácteos hace  11  años donde ofrece (frijoles, queso, yuca, malanga entre otras cosas) teniendo como clientes a los propietarios de las pulperías que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. Este es el segundo crédito del microempresario. Cabe destacar que los productos que el oferta no han disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 5 quintales de Frijoles a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal y  3 quintales de queso a $ 120.00 dólares el quintal con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To buy beans and cheese

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert B. is 32 years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. Albert is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and televisions. He would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Nery Zulema

texts.es:
Nery is married and has two children, who are 12 and 14 years old. Her husband works as a salesman. Nery previously ran a cafeteria at a school, but when the school hired a new principal Nery and her husband found themselves unemployed. This was three years ago, and they decided to start another business to earn income. They started with what was left of the cafeteria and began to collect more merchandise, until they had enough for a grocery store. Nery and her husband have now installed the grocery store in their garage.

Nery needs a loan of $1100, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the money to supply the store with new products to boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Nery es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 14 años, su esposo trabaja como vendedor. Ella inició el negocio porque tenía una cafetería en una escuela, y hubo cambio de director y se las pidieron, por lo cual se quedaron sin trabajo su esposo y ella al mismo tiempo, y tuvieron que poner otro negocio para obtener ingresos. Hace aproximadamente poco mas de 3 años, empezaron con lo que les quedo de la cafetería, poco a poco fueron teniendo mas mercancía, hasta llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes que hoy por hoy tienen, mismo que instalaron en lo que era la cochera de su casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1100 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir el negocio con productos que aun no tienen en existencia, y poder vender mas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Claudia Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Claudia is a widow, and has five children. They are28, 26, 22, 21, and 20 years old, respectively. Claudia's business originally belonged to her husband, who taught her how to manage the finances and buy and sell goats. Claudia's husband was the only thing that she had to get ahead, and when he died Claudia faced the challenge of running a successful business. This business is 30 years old, and thanks to help from two of her sons, Claudia has been able to keep it running successfully.

Claudia needs a loan of $1100, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the capital to buy goats and supplies for a restaurant, as some of her clients have not paid her, and this delayed her deliveries. With this loan Claudia will be able to fulfill her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es viuda y tiene 5 hijos de 28, 26, 22, 21 y 20 años. inicialmente el negocio lo tenia su esposo, pero el fallece y ella se queda con el, ya que era lo que tenia para poder salir adelante, y enfrentándose al reto de sacar adelante el negocio ya que su esposo alcanzo a enseñarle como administrar y llevar a cabo la compra venta de los cabritos. Este negocio tiene 30 años funcionando y gracias al apoyo de 2 de sus hijos han podido mantenerlo con éxito.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1100 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar cabritos y surtir pedidos que tiene de un restaurante, ya que algunos de sus clientes no le han pagado, y esto le retrasa sus entregas, con este crédito va a tener la posibilidad de cumplir sus compromisos.

loans.use: Buy goats

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina M. is married and has two kids. She lives with her family at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 35 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past four years. Faustina needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her purchase a large quantity of good quality merchandise to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' clothing, and slippers

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua B. is married and has three kids. She lives with her family at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 33 years old.  For the past nine years, she has run a clothing stand, selling ladies' and children's items like blouses and skirts, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her purchase a large quantity of good quality inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou B. est une veuve de 53 ans, mère de 6 enfants (4 garçons et 2 filles) et vit avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koko koro de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).
 Elle s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui est la teinture de bazin (Tissus très prisé en Afrique de l’ouest) dès son jeune âge au sein d’une association féminine de la ville de Koutiala. Avec 15 ans d’expériences dans le metier, elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans la localité de Koutiala et reçoit ainsi beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies et des fetes.
 Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante elle sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après 3 prêts de groupe avec une association de femmes de son quartier, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 3 pièces de bazin, 3 kg de teinture de différentes couleurs et 4 kg de potasse. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures) Elle teint les tissus dans son atelier (à domicile). Ensuite elle les revend au comptant ou à crédit, généralement aux revendeuses des bazins teintés, aux couturiers à certaines femmes de son quartier, à l’exterieur du Mali tel Libreville (République du Gabon) et Kayes( première région administrative du Mali) où deux de ses  enfants reçoivent et vendent la production.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA, qu’elle envisage utiliser pour payer les intérêts du  prêt et participer aux dépenses de la famille. Madame Kadiatou B. compte ouvrir une boutique de vente de bazin teinté  de différentes couleurs au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadiatou B. is a 53 year old widow, the mother of six children, four boys and two girls, and lives with her co-spouse and their children in the Koko koro district in the Koutiala prefecture (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). She began the business of dying the bazin, an esteemed fabric in Western Africa, at a young age in a woman's association in the city of Koutiala. With 15 years of experience in this trade, she enjoys a good reputation in the Koutiala community and has had a large amount of orders, especially during ceremonies and holidays. In her search for financial resources to help her meet her clientele’s ever-growing demand, she began to work with Soro Yiriwaso and has maintained this relationship for four years. After having participated in three group loans with a group of women in her district, she is currently on her third individual loan, having successfully paid back all the previous loans. With this loan, she plans to purchase three pieces of bazin, three kilograms of different colored dyes, and four kilograms of potash. She will buy her materials (white bazins, caustic soda and dyes) at Bamako. Then she will dye the fabrics in her workshop, which is in her house. Afterwards, she will sell them for cash or credit and generally to salespersons of dyed bazins, dressmakers, women from her neighborhood, outside of Mali, such as in Libreville in the Republic of Gabon, and in Kayes (the first administrative region of Mali), where two of her children will receive and resell the fabrics. She hopes to make a 90,000 FCFA monthly profit, which she will put towards the interest on her loan and also to help with her family’s expenses. Mrs. Kadiatou B. would like to open a store that sells dyed bazins of different colors at the Koutiala market.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bazin, a special fabric, caustic soda and dyes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is 34 years old. She is divorced, with three kids. She lives with her kids at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She works hard to support her children in school. Victoria has been selling bread at a bus stop for thirteen years. She obtains her supply from bakers at wholesale prices, and sells at retail prices for a profit. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth.  She believes that with the loan she will be able to purchase more loaves of bread and increase sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to save enough money to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more loaves of bread.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua A., a 35-year-old woman, is married and has four children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc., to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to make enough money to sponsor her kids' education.  She would be thankful for the support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Mr. Rene I. is 26 years old and lives with his mother and brother.

Rene was employed at woodshop owned by his uncle, where he worked for 2 years. In 2002 he decided to set up his own shop with a small amount of money he had saved. He currently makes furniture for national sale, and he also sells clothing at installments in his neighborhood and he does well because he has a sold client base.

His personal goal is to make his wood shop bigger in order to be able to produce more furniture, and in this way gain more income.

He is requesting a loan to buy some land, where he hopes to move to in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Rene I. de 26 años de edad, esta viviendo con su madre y un hermano.

Rene fue empleado de una carpintería, cuyo propietario es su tío, donde trabajo 2 años. En el 2002, fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba. Actualmente esta fabricando mubles para su posterior venta en el interior del país, también vende ropas a cuota por su barrio en el cual le va muy bien por que ya tiene una clientela bien formada.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería para llegar a fabricar mas muebles, y lograr así un mejor ingreso.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un terreno, donde futuramente desea mudar su carpintería.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Djidja (Effort) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Djidja (5 veuves, 1 jeune fille et 4 femmes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier administratif de Markala ( Une des sous  préfecture de Ségou quatrième région administrative du Mali)
Le groupe Djidja fait le commerce d’articles divers : les condiments alimentaires, les matériels en plastiques, les céréales, les tissus et les chaussures. Ce groupe constitué de parentes, de voisines et d’amies emprunte ensemble depuis maintenant 2 ans auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers un documentaire à la télévision nationale.  Le groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et a correctement remboursé tous les prêts précédents.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 4 pièces de tissu, 3 sacs de mil, un colis de chaussures, une quantité importante de condiments et des seaux en plastique.  Elles s’approvisionnent en tissus, chaussures et seaux en plastique à Ségou et au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de grossistes. Par contre les condiments et les céréales sont achetés sur place à Markala, Niono, Dougabougou et  Seribala auprès des maraîchers de la zone inondée de l’office du Niger. Les produits sont vendus au comptant et parfois à crédit dans les marchés des différents quartiers (Diamarabougou et Kirango) de Markala et à la foire du village de Sansanding. La clientèle essentiellement constituée d’hommes et de femmes vient des grandes villes. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 35.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, à subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans l’activité.
Elles ambitionnent de diversifier leurs activités en faisant de la riziculture et l’importation des tissus en provenance du Burkina Faso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Djidja, composed of five widows, one young woman, and four married women, has an average age of 47 and three children on average. The majority of the members live with large traditional families in the administrative quarter Markala, one of the prefectures of Ségou, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali. The group Djidja has businesses that sell various items: condiments, plastic products, cereals, fabrics and shoes. This group consists of relatives, neighbors and friends and has, after having learned of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso on a documentary that aired on national television, been taking out loans for two years. This is the group’s third group loan and the group has successfully paid back all previous loans. They plan to use the loan to purchase four pieces of fabrics, three sacks of millet, a parcel of shoes, a significant amount of condiments and plastic buckets. They will buy the fabrics, shoes and buckets from wholesalers in Ségou and at the market of Bamako, the capital of Mali. On the other hand, the condiments and cereals will be purchased in Markala, Niono, Dougabougou and Seribala from producers from the area that are irrigated by the Office du Niger. The products are sold for cash and sometimes for credit, in the markets in the different districts of Markala (Diamarabougou and Kirango) and at the village fair in Sansanding. The clientele is essentially made up of men and women from large cities. The members of the group hope to each make approximately a 35,000 FCFA monthly profit, which will go towards paying the interest on the loan and help with the needs of their families. What is left over will be invested their businesses. They hope to diversify their businesses by growing rice and importing fabrics from Burkina Faso.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items

loans.name: Tièssiri (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit (8) membres du groupe Tièssiri (1 veuve, 5 femmes mariées et 2 jeunes filles) ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles élargies traditionnelles au quartier administratif du village de Markala une des sous préfecture de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations sociales et économiques ces femmes du groupe Tiessiri de Markala exercent le commerce de poisson frais, de condiments alimentaires et des produits agricoles.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance avec lequel il est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 kg de poissons frais, 3 sacs d’arachide et une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons frais auprès des pêcheurs au bord du fleuve Niger à Markala, en condiments avec des forains venant de la région de Sikasso et des villages environnants. Pour les céréales auprès des forains des marchés de N., Dougabougou, Boussin et Sansanding.
Les condiments et les céréales sont vendus sur place à Markala et dans les villages voisins en détail au comptant et parfois à crédit aux marchés de Diamarabougou, Kirango et Sansanding. Le poisson frais est vendu aux hôteliers venant des grandes villes telles que Ségou et Bamako. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui servira à augmenter le fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elles comptent diversifier leurs activités en faisant du  commerce de tissus.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Tièssiri (meaning "Courage") of Markala are composed of one widow, five married women, and two girls. They average 43 years in age and three children. They live in traditional extended families in the administrative district of the village of Markala, one of the sub-prefectures of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by social and economic ties, these women do commerce in fresh fish, condiments, and agricultural produce. To satisfy their continuously growing number of customers, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution loan program with which they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). All of the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy: 100 kg of fresh fish, 3 sacks of peanuts, and a sizable quantity of condiments. They get their supplies of fish from fishermen on the banks of the Niger River in Markala; their condiments are from vendors coming from the Sikasso region and from neighboring villages; their grain is from vendors of the marketplaces of N., Dougabougou, Boussin et Sansanding. The condiments and grain are sold retail for cash locally in Markala and in neighboring villages. Sometimes sales are made on credit at the marketplaces of Diamarabougou, Kirango et Sansanding. The fresh fish is sold to hotel owners who come from big cities, such as Ségou et Bamako. They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will serve to increase operating capital, to cover the loan interest, and to provide for family needs. They intend to diversify their businesses through commerce in cloth.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, peanuts, and condiments

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jesús is a member of the Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women) Communal Bank, situated in AA.HH Héroes del Cenepa Mz.D Lt. 6, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 29 years of age, and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, she decided to invest in the sale of food. Jesús currently sells sodas and frozen treats.

With this loan of S/. 1.000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 3 cases of small sodas, 2 cases of large sodas and ingredients to prepare her frozen treats.

Jesús is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity of offering a loan for her business, and as such, she is very happy because she can help with her household’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Productivas, ubicado en AA. HH Héroes del Cenepa Mz.D Lt. 6, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es obrero. Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida.

Jesús, en la actualidad cuenta con venta de gaseosa y chupetes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1.000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 cajas de gaseosa chica, 2 paquetes de Gaseosa grande y ingrediente para que prepare su chupetes.

Jesus, esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de brindarle un crédito para su negocio y de tal manera se siente muy contenta porque apoya en los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase sodas of several sizes and ingredients to prepare frozen treats.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) II Communal Bank, situated in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte / Maya Brito, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 32 years of age and is the mother of one child. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, Juana decided to invest in the sale of seafood.

Juana currently continues with the sale of seafood. Every day, she goes to the Bellavista Market to offer her fish, and fortunately, she sells everything she takes. Her great charisma brings her customers back to her.

With this loan of S/ 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 100kg of a variety of seafood.

Juana is grateful for the opportunity she has been given because she can continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas II, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte / Maya Brito del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 1 hijos. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de pescado.

Juana, en la actualidad continua con la venta de pescado. Todos los días sale al mercado Bellavista para ofrecer sus pescados y felizmente todo lo que lleva lo vende su gran carisma hace que los clientes le consuman

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 100 kilos de variedad de pescado.

Juana, agradece a la oportunidad que se le ha brindado ya que puede seguir incrementando su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase seafood wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) II Communal Bank, situated in Av. Aguaytía # 500, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 67 years of age, and is the mother of six children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, Judith decided to invest in a grocery store.

Judith has her grocery store and tends to it with the help of two of her grandchildren that are in her care. Additionally, she offers rooms for rent.

With this loan of S/ 1,700, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase materials to construct more rooms and a few basic items for her grocery store.

At her age, Judith is a woman who is not easily discouraged and continues to succeed despite certain difficulties she faces in her daily life.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas II, ubicado en el Av. Aguaytía # 500 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Judith con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en una bodega.

Judith, cuenta con una bodega y atienD. con la ayuda D. 2 D. sus nietos que esta a cargo D. ella. Paralelamente ofrece cuartos en alquiler.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará materiales para así poder seguir implementando mas cuartos y algunos productos D. primera necesidad para su bodega.

Judith, con la edad que ella cuenta es una mujer que no desmaya y sigue sobresaliendo a pesar D. ciertas dificultades que se les presenta en su vida cotidiana.

loans.use: Purchase materials to construct more rooms and a few basic items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Waradjan (Grand Lion) Group

texts.fr:
