El Sr. René Gámez está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la losa en un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta. El trabajo de chofer de un camión de carga trabajo todo el día ya que está a su cargo sus papás que son personas mayores de edad y no pueden ya trabajar. (En la foto aparece su mama porque el solicitante se encontraba trabajando).

El ha tenido préstamo en FVP el cual pago puntualmente y esta solicitándole uno a KIVA para la elaboración de una losa en un cuarto que es para sus papás ya que la habitación que están habitando es muy chica y necesitan mas espacio y acondicionarla a una manera que sea más accesible para ellos.

loans.use: Laying of concrete slab in a room.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Mr. René Gámez is applying for a loan to make slab for a spare room. He works as a truck driver all day as his parents are in his care; they are of age and not able to work anymore. (His mother is shown in the photo as the applicant was working).

Mr. Gámez has had a loan with FVP which was punctually repaid and now he is requesting one from KIVA to build a room for his parents as their present room is very small and they need more space and comfort to make it more accessible.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. René Gámez está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la losa en un cuarto que le esta haciendo falta. El trabajo de chofer de un camión de carga trabajo todo el día ya que está a su cargo sus papás que son personas mayores de edad y no pueden ya trabajar. (En la foto aparece su mama porque el solicitante se encontraba trabajando).

El ha tenido préstamo en FVP el cual pago puntualmente y esta solicitándole uno a KIVA para la elaboración de una losa en un cuarto que es para sus papás ya que la habitación que están habitando es muy chica y necesitan mas espacio y acondicionarla a una manera que sea más accesible para ellos.

loans.use: Laying of concrete slab in a room.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona P. B. is 66 years old, with no children on her custody. She is a widow dedicated to sell a variety of clothing. Her business is located at a stall on the Raul Cabezas' market or central market. Ramona has more than 30 years dedicated to this activity and she has been able to raise her children which own their businesses at the present time. With the support of the loans, she has been able to improve her living conditions like her own home. Even at her age, she thinks of the possibility of adquiring another unit of transportation that can serve as a taxi. The taxi will generate a source of employment. She is a dedicated woman who works hard and has a lot of desire for improving herself.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ramona P. B., Tiene 66 años de edad, no tiene hijos a su cargo, es viuda, su actividad economica es la venta de ropa variada ubicado en un modulo del mercado Raul Cabezas o central. La señora tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, con el cual ha sacado a adelante a sus hijos que en la actualidad cada uno de ellos tienen sus propios negocios, Con el apoyo de estos creditos ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida como es su casa de habitacion, a pesar de su edad tiene la perspectiva de poder adquirir otra unidad de transporte taxi, con el cual pretende generar fuentes de empleo, ella es una mujer muy luchadora con muchos deseos de superacion.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lidia Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Olivia L. is 55 years old aand the mother of two children.  One of them, atually, is working and her other daughter is on her fifth year in high school.  She is single and doesn't receive any economic support.  She has been a traveling salesperson for 20 years. She sells clothes, shoes, cosmetics, carbonated beverages, chicken, and laminated gold.  This activity has been the main source of income for her and the family. Her dream is to strenghten her small business and make it into a solid small grocery store operation out of her home. She has experience in this area but lacks the necessary resources to develop her goal and stop being a traveling salesperson so she can enjoy more time with her daughter.
Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La sñora Olivia L. tiene 55 años de edad, madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos actualemnte esta trabajando, su otra hija cursa el quinto años de secundaria, es soltera no tiene ayuda economica de nadie, se dedica a la venta de ropa calzado, cosmeticos, gaseosa, pollo, oro laminado, de forma ambualante teniendo mas de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual ha sido su fuente de ingresos familiar, sus sueño es poder fortalecer su pequeño negocio y constituirlo como una pulperia bien solida en su casa de habitacion, ya que ella tiene la experiencia en este rubro, pero no tiene los recursos suficientes para poder cumplir con su proposito de esta manera dejar de andar comercializando de forma ambulante y pasar mas tiempo con su hija.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Isidora De Los Angel

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is 54 years of age, is unmarried and is responsible for two grandchildren. Mrs. S. sells general merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and other items. With the loans she has received she has managed to invest in grocery store products since one of her greatest dreams is to establish her own store. Currently, she goes out and sells her products and also takes care of an elderly woman, with the purpose of being able to acquire more income in order to move forward with her two grandchildren which were left to her care after the death of her daughter. One of her biggest challenges is to raise the children since they have nobody else to depend on.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sanches tiene 54 años de edad es soltera tiene a su cargo a dos nietos , la señora S. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general como es venta de ropa cosmetico y otros con los creditos adquiridos con fundacion ella ha logrado ir invirtiendo en productos de pulperia ya que uno de sus mayores sueños es poder establecerse , en la actualidad sale a vender y tambien sale a cuidar a una señora de la tercera edad , con el proposito de poder adquirir mas ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus dos nietos los cuales le quedaron al fallecer su hija y uno de sus grandes retos es poder lograr formarlos ya que los niños no cuentan con nadie mas.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es:
Edma is unmarried and is 84 years old, she lives with her brother. She sells general merchandise including clothing, footwear, perfumes, and cosmetics; she travels to Panama and Guatemala to obtain supplies and makes dozens of deliveries to her permanent customers. Ms. T. is not responsible for anyone because she was never married, but she says that one of her greatest dreams is to be able to acquire enough capital in the event that she can no longer continue traveling, and fix her house. 
 Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer. 

La señora Edma es soltera tiene 84 años de edad vive con un hermano , ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general ropa calzado perfumes cosmeticos y otros viaja a panama y Guatemala a abastecerse y entrega por docena en el mercado teniendo clientes fijos , la señora T. no tiene a cargo a nadie ya que ella nunca se caso, pero manifiesta que uno de sus grandes sueños es poder reunir suficiente capital para el momento en que ella ya no pueda seguir viajando, y acondicionar su casa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es:
Ms. R. is a single mother with four children that depend on her, one of which attends college and the other three are in high school. She owns a brick kiln located at her home which she inherited from her father. She makes washer blocks, pvc pipes, she sells sand and cement bricks, with her business she has been able to raise her children, three of whom are from her marriage and one adopted. One of her greatest dreams is to ensure that her four children complete a college career and also to open another branch when demand is stronger, that way she can continue acquiring better technology.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a su cargo uno en la universidad y los otros tres en secundaria , ella es dueña de una bloquera ubicada en su casa la cual es herencia de su padre , ella elabora bloques lavanderos tubos de pvc ,vende ladrillos arena y cemento , con su negocio a logrado formar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son de su matrimonio y uno adoptado uno de sus grandes sueños es poder lograr que los cuatro coronen una carrera universitaria y tambien poder abrir una sucursal en un punto donde la demanda es mas fuerte, asi mismo poder ir adquiriendo mejor tecnologia.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es:
Ms. T. is 38 years old, is married with two children, one of which is in college and the other is in elementary school. She counts on the help of her husband who works as a private consultant and she also has a fixed income as a teacher. She is the owner of a shop located in her house, which helps them improve their living conditions. With the loans she has acquired, she has expanded her business; one of her biggest dreams is to strengthen her business everyday thereby moving her family ahead and to achieve a college education for her two children. 
 Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer. 

La señora T. tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos uno de ellos en la Universidad y el otro en primaria cuenta con la ayuda de sus esposo quien se desempeña como consultor privado y tambien ella tiene ingresos fijos como docente , pero a su vez es dueña de una tienda ubicada en su casa, con la cual ellos se ayudan para ir mejorando su condiciones de vida Con los creditos adquiridos ella ha hido ampliando su negocio y uno de sus mayores sueños es poder cada dia ir fortaleciendo su actividad para con ello lograr salir adelante con su familia y que sus dos hijos logren coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sei

texts.en:
Mrs. Sei K., 44, is a widowed grocery seller as well as a rice grower in Danrun Commune, Siem Reap Province. She has been selling since 2003, and earns approximately $4 a day. She doesn't have children of her own, but cares for her two nephews.

Her grocery-selling business has more and more customers. Sei needs to expand her business with more grocery stock to meet customer demand. She would like to request a loan to purchase grocery stock, and the rest she will use to expand her farmland to grow rice.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock and to expand her farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat S. is a farmer, and also sells fish and vegetables in the town market. Her husband, Mr. Chan Em, is a fisherman. She created a group to get the loan, and is group leader with three members. Yat has three children, all of whom are in school and lives in Vat Tamim Commune, Battambang Province.

The farming business is the main income in her family, so she needs to expand and strengthen it. She now is requesting a loan for rice growing, including farmland plowing expenses, and purchasing seeds.

Her group members are following: Mrs. Mommy M., who is requesting a loan to use for fish, vegetable, and beef selling by bicycle; Mr. Lymin S., who is requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: For rice growing, including farmland plowing expenses, and purchasing seeds.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly O. is a 53-year-old seller who sells groceries in Korkthlork Commune, Chykreng District, in the Siem Reap Province. She typically earns about 10,000 Riel (US$2.5) per day. Her husband, Mr. Sharin Soun, a 65-year-old farmer, earns approximately 4,000 Riel (US$1.00) per day. He has four children living in the family’s home. Two of his children are married, and one daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan of 2,000,000 Riel (US$500) to purchase more grocery stocks to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase a plot of farmland to expand their farming business. The loan allows her to improve her business to sustain her family's daily income. Mrs. Ly's husband is pictured with daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks to sell and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar P. is 29 years old, and her husband, Mr. Shoeun Shean, is 30 years old. They fish in Tonle Sap Lake, together earning approximately $5 a day. Fishing has been their main income since 2000. She has three children, living in Anlong Somnor Commune, Chykreng District in the Sieap Reap Province.

Because of lacking fishing tools, Mrs. Sar would like to request a $300 loan to purchase fishing tools such as eel-traps and nets. Purchasing these items with help of the loan will increase their incomes. They will be able to support her family's living. Mrs. Sar's husband is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools such as eel-trap, nets

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya C. is a 30-year-old rice farmer. She earns about $1.60 per day. She lives in Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province. Her husband, Mr. Kren Vu, is a 33-year-old fisherman, and fishes around Tunle Sap Lake. He earns approximately $3.00 per day. They live with their four children and grandparents.

To increase the family's income, Mrs. Ya would like to request a loan of $300 to use for her husband's fishing tools. The loan allows for growing the business and increases income.

loans.use: To use for husband's fishing business, to purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Mr. Jaime G. owns a low-income dwelling in the city of Nuevo Laredo. He would like to install tile flooring in his house because its current cement floor is quite uncomfortable to live on.

Mr. G. works in a company all day long. His wife is the one who looks after the children. She is pictured above, since Mr. Garcia was at work.

He is requesting this loan from Kiva in order to purchase the materials necessary for the installation of tile flooring in his house because he currently does not have the funds necessary to do so due to his children’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Jaime G. es propietario de una vivienda económica en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo donde desea poner vitropiso en la casa ya que el que tiene actualmente es de cemento y es muy incomodo estar habitando la casa.

El Sr. Jaime trabaja todo el día y la que se encarga de los hijos y la casa es su esposa cuando se realizo la visita solo se encontraba la Sra. Emilia Perez y uno de sus hijos.

El esta solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para comprar el material necesario para colocar el vitroposo de su casa ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material por los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

loans.use: Installation of tile flooring

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Miss Esmeralda Díaz is requesting a loan in order to build a protective wall and a concrete patio since she works all day and her house is unprotected. She fears that something bad might happen when she is away from home.

The client has previously received a loan from FVP. She requested a loan, which she repaid punctually, in order to give the down payment on her house. She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Srita. Esmeralda Díaz esta solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de una barda y piso de cementó en el patio de su casa ya que ella trabaja todo el día ya la casa esta muy desprotegida y teme a que le pase algo cuando ella no este en su casa.

La solicitante ya fue acreditada de FVP ella solicito un préstamo para completar el enganche para adquirir su casa el cual lo pago puntualmente. Y ahora esta solicitándole una a Kiva para poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: Build protective wall and concrete patio

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Guzmán is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to construct a protective wall around her house because her son and three grandchildren live with her, and the children are not well-protected. 
Mrs. Guzmán works, and her son helps with the household expenses. However, she currently does not have the funds needed for the project, which is why she now turns to the microfinance institute for help. She previously received a loan from FVP and promptly repaid it. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
La Sra. Maria Guzmán es solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la elaboración de una barda alrededor de su casa ya que con ella vive su hijo y tres nietos y no esta bien protegida para los niños.
La Sra. Guzmán trabajo y también su hijo le ayudan con los gastos de la  casa, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder hacer la mejora que desea es por eso que acudió a las oficinas ya que a sido acreditad de FVP y pago puntualmente.

loans.use: Construct protective wall around house

loans.name: Judith Jaqueline

texts.es:
Ms. Judith R. is building bedrooms in her home, but they need paving stone. She currently does not have the necessary funds because she is a single mother of 3 school age children. She does not have enough money to pay cash for the paving stone materials for her children’s new rooms. There is currently only one room for all three children in the house. 
Ms. R. works in a restaurant in downtown Nuevo Laredo. This job is her source of income that helps her to move forward and to offer her children the best. 
She is requesting this loan from Kiva for home improvements so that her children can have a better place in which to live.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
La Sra, Judith esta construyendo unos cuartos los cuales le esta haciendo falta la losa y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero para pagar de contado el material para poner la losa en los cuartos los cuales son para sus hijos y que en la casa donde viven solo hay un cuarto para los tres niños.
La Sra. Judith trabaja en un restauran en el centro de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo este es su ingreso para poder salir adelante y darle los mejor a sus hijos.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder realizar las mejoras a su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan un mejor  hogar donde vivir.

loans.use: Install paving stone

loans.name: Fatma's Tujitahidi Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 21, 18, 15, and 12 years old. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 40 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal and juice sales, bites sales, cassava sales, and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Maryam's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 7, 4 and 2 years old. She has been a juice and fish seller since 1990. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 60 from her sales.

Maryam now hopes for a loan to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaisha, who also has a business dealing with fish sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 35 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 years and 6 months. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwanaisha now hopes for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
Nasimjon D. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of three wonderful children. In February of 1998, Nasimjon was unemployed. One of his friend invited him to start up a business repairing and making furniture. This was something new for him but he decided to try. Fortunately everything went well and the customers were convinced about the quality of the products he recommended to everybody. His portfolio of clients is increasing and he feels very proud of his achievements. 

Since Nasimjon has a lot of customers, the business is very successful and brings in stable and significant income allowing him to improve living conditions for his family. Today Nasimjon is requesting 600 US Dollars to purchase wood and other supplies for making furniture. He would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Nasimjon is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Nasimjon’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing wood and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en: H. Ismoil is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. His wife works as a housekeeper. Ismoil owns a minivan, and provides transportation services to the residents of Khujand. Initially, Isomil began his business using a car, but after accumulating his earnings, he was able to afford a minivan. His dedication and responsible work ethic has established him a good reputation. Ismoil’s minivan is in need of a major repair, and he is now requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase spare parts for his car. He and his family thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and repair his minivan

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old. She is married with three children, ages 7, 2, and 1. She has owned a small spice shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Mwaka's Tunatumai Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is four years old and the other is three. She has been an embroidery and bed sheet seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwaka now requests a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with tailoring and shoe sales, bites (snacks) sales, clothes sales, juice sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Hidaya's Tunatumai Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 33 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 16 and 3 years old. She is a tailoring and bites seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 30 from her sales.

Hidaya now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring and bites sales, juice sales, food sales, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son C. is a 41-year-old widow. She works hard at her fishing business every day on Tunle Sap Lake. She has been fishing since 1998 and earns approximately $2.50 a day. She lives with four children; one is married, the oldest is a fisherman, earning approximately $2.50 per day, and her one daughter earns some selling grocery items. They live in Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province.

Mrs. Son seeks a loan to purchase a fishing boat to use for her fishing business. She hopes the loan will improve her business and sustain the family living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat to use for the fishing business

loans.name: Chiku's Tukumbuke Group

texts.en:
Chiku is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 1. She has sold charcoal and firewood since 2001. She works at her business every day and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Chiku is now hoping for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Raya and Sada, who have businesses dealing with selling clothes and bread.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mwatima

texts.en:
Mwatima is 35 years old. She is married with four children who are aged 12, 7, 5 and 2. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 9:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Mwatima now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business

loans.name: Thi Thin's Group

texts.vi:
Cô Nguyễn thị Thìn Ms 01050042 nă nay 49 tuổi, vợ chồng cô sinh được 3 người con. Trong đó 2 con đã đi xây dựng gia đình, hiện tại chỉ còn một con đang đi học đại học. Hàng ngày chồng cô giúp cô đi lấy thịt bò về bán, cô rất chịu khó và nhanh nhẹn. cô đã vay vốn được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt ,lần hai này cô đăng ký vay mức 5.152.000 VND để mua thịt trâu, bò về bán tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tại mức thu nhập của 2 vợ chồng cô thu được từ 150.000 VND đến 180.000 VND/ ngày. Trong nhóm cô có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Cúc Ms 01050043 chị vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua lợn nái về nuôi
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thiết Ms 01050044 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua vải về may quần áo
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thao Ms 01050045 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh chén, bát
  • chị Đặng thị Ngọc Ms 01050047 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Lê thị Môn Ms 01050048 vay mức 2.912.000 VND để kinh doanh hàng khô
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chí Ms 01050051 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh đồ nhựa
  • chị Ngô thị Hiền Ms 01050052 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sản xuất túi đựng đồ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Viên Ms 01050053 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh hàng khô
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Thin (ID Number 01050042), 49 years old, has 3 children. 2 of them have already been married whiL. the youngest one is attending college. Everyday, her husband buys beef, which is then resold at the market by Mrs. Thin. Mrs. Thin is very hardworking. She has already borrowed one loan and repaid the loan fully. This time, she would like to borrow 5,152,000VND to purchase beef and buffalo meat to sell, so as to increase the family's income. Her family's current daily income is from 150,000VND to 200,000VND (about 9.40USD to 12.50USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Cuc (ID Number 01050043), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thiet (ID Number 01050044), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID Number 01050045), borrows 4,256,000VND to buy and sell crockery.
  • Mrs. Dang Thi Ngoc (ID Number 01050047), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Mon (ID Number 01050048), borrows 2,912,000VND to sell dried goods.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Chi (ID Number 01050051), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell plastic products.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID Number 01050052), borrows 3,186,000VND to produce grocery bags.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Vien (ID Number 01050053), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell dried goods.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling beef and buffalo meat

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children who are aged 10, 7, 4 and 2. She has owned a small food shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $350 from her sales.

Sada now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, sugar, wheat flour, and salt for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her business

loans.name: Mgeni's Tuwe Sawa. Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is 30 years old. She is married with one child who is 3 years old. She has been a seller of tea, bread, and soup since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $255 from her sales.

Mgeni now hopes for a loan to buy more items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mariam Z. and Mariam P., who also have businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mwanjab's Tuwe Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Mwanjab is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 5, and 3 years old. She has been a clothes (khanga: traditional Tanzanian cloth worn as a wrap) seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

Mwanjab now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zainab and Fatma, who have businesses dealing with kiosk ownership and clothing sales.

loans.use: To  buy more clothes (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Hoa MS 11020014, năm nay 27 tuổi chị là người rất nhanh nhẹn tháo vát. Trước đây chị đã đi chợ sắt vụn, làm ruộng, cùng đi làm thuê cùng chồng để nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Nay chị mới đi học được nghề làm bún, nên chị đã đầu tư mua sắm máy móc để sản xuất mỳ. vì vậy chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình ở mức 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung thêm vào mua gạo làm bún bán. Hiện tại mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm của chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Mai MS 11020015 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua máy đầu tư làm mộc
  • chị N. thị Chín MS 11020016 vay mức 3.186.000 VND mua gỗ để làm mộc
  • chị Ngô thị Hằng MS 11020017 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi buôn trứng
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ước MS 11020018 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám vịt
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID Number 11020014), 27 years old, is very hardworking. Before this, she used to buy and sell scraps, perform agricultural tasks and work as hired worker with her husband to raise her two children. However, she learned to make rice noodles, so she has purchased machinery to produce noodles. Therefore, she would like to borrow 2,006,000VND to invest in buying rice to make noodles. Currently, her family's average daily income is from 150,000VND to 200,000VND (about 9.40USD to 12.50USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thị Mai (ID Number 11020015), borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase machinery for her carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. Nghiem Thị Chin (ID Number 11020016) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase wood for her carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi Hang (ID Number 11020017) borrows 3,186,000VND to buy and sell eggs.
  • Mrs. N. Thị Uoc (ID Number 11020018) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase duck feeds.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice to make noodles

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu  is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 children, aged 12, 7, and 5 years. She has been selling chips and fruit since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US400 from her sales.
 
Tatu  now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Asha's Zina Mola Group

texts.en:
Asha is single with 4 children aged 21, 18, 16 and 3 years old. She has sold fish since 2002. She works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.
 
Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with sales of clothes, juice, food, firewood, fish, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her buisness.

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 26 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and coconut seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Mati

texts.en:
Mati is 49 years old, divorced, with 4 children aged 30, 21, 15 and 11 years old. She has sold charcoal and fish since 2003. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
 
Mati now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fish for her business.

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame Adiaratou O. est âgée de  34 ans et  vit avec ses 4 enfants( 2 garçons et 2 filles) et son époux dans une famille monogame à Noumousso  un des quartiers de la préfecture de Kadiolo (Région de Sikasso  République du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de pagnes, d’encense et des coupons de tissus racommodés en draps de lit. Pour obtenir des ressources financières supplémentaires afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution  Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés ses prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter 7 pièces de pagne wax (tissus prisés en Afrique de l’ouest), 10kg d’encense et 50kg de coupons de tissus pour en faire des draps de lit (au Burkina Faso pays frontalier du Mali).
Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant en détail et en gros sur place à la maison et de façon ambulante à travers la ville de Kadiolo. Sa clientèle est constituée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA.qui servira à augmenter la taille de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou O. is 34 and lives with her 4 children (two sons and two daughters) and her husband in a monogamous family in Noumousso, one of the districts of Kadiolo Prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

After having been engaged in several revenue-generating businesses, she decided to specialize in selling "pagnes" (brightly patterned West African cloth), incense, and remnants of cloth made into sheets. In order to find supplementary financial resources so that she would be able to satisfy all her clientele which is continually growing, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having successfully reimbursed her group loans together with an association from her neighborhood, she is now requesting her first individual loan.

She is planning to buy 7 lengths of wax print cloth (cloth that is much esteemed in West Africa), 10 kg of incense, and 50 kg of cloth remnants to be made into bed sheets (in Burkina Faso, a country which borders Mali).

She re-sells her merchandise for cash retail and also wholesale, at her home and door-to-door across the town of Kadiolo. Her clientele is essentially made up of women. With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which she hopes to reinvest in order to expand her business.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of remnants of cloth, lengths of wax print, and ingredients for incense

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom T. is a 58-year-old farmer, earning approximately $0.50 per day while her husband, Mr. Chan Phok, is a 51-year-old construction worker. She has three children, one is married, and one is a garment worker in Phnom Penh Municipal and another one sells sugar cane juice in Koktlok Krom Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Mrs. Yom requests a loan of $400 to purchase one more machine to crush sugar cane for making juice. The loan will allow her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for crushing sugar cane to make sugar cane juice to sell

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
This is an orphan boy, Shakir U.. He is 23 and engaged. He has been living with 13 members of his family in the Ningarhar province for about 20 years. His older brother is a car driver and two others are studying in a public school.

When his father was living, he had a small retail shop in Jalalabad city and theiee lives were going better. Shakir U. was helping his father in shopkeeping.

Just four months ago when his father died, some thieves were stole their money and a lot of expensive goods from their shop. These problems brought a lot of difficulties. His brothers had to leave the school and start some work, because their financial problems were increasing day by day. Shakir U. was so worried about it and didn't know how to struggle with these difficulties. 

Finally one of his relatives gave them some money as a loan, to start their business once again. ShakirU. bought a car and started driving. After two months he was able to re-enroll his brothers in a public school and now he can stand on its own feet. 

Shakir U. was able to repay 50% of the loan in a month. tTen he gave the car to his brother for driving, and he purchased some goods for his shop and started his own business for the second time.

Now Shakir U. is happy with life, and he wants to expand his business more. Even though he knows the business well, unfortunately, he doesn't have enough capital for this purpose. Therefore he has requested a loan, to purchase rice, oil, sugar, or other goods for his shop.

Shakir U. dreams to repay this loan as soon as possible and stand on his own feet completely, and then he will marry. Also he has planned to buy a big general store in the central location of the city in the future. Finally he thanks the lenders so much.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, and other goods for his shop

loans.name: Mwanakombo's Bora Utu Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children. She has been a bites (chapati) and coffee seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanakombo has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanakombo is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sada, who has a business dealing with charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is married with one child, aged 5. She has been a firewood and bites seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 90 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to expand her business

loans.name: Reung

texts.en:
Mr. Reung C. is a 45-year-old fisherman, fishing around Tunle Sap Lake. He has been fishing for eight years and earns $2.50 a day. His wife, Mrs. Hem Yann, 44, earns $2.50 a day selling groceries. She has two children, both are students. They all live in Kompong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Mr. Reung decided, along with his wife; to request a loan of $200 so his wife can purchase more groceries for resale. He hopes the loan will expand his business and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is 33 years old. She is married with 5 children aged 16, 11, 9, 6, and 1. She has been a juice seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Mkasi is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tatu's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Tatu, married with five children between the ages of 11 and 28, has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2003. She works daily from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her three subgroup members, who have businesses in fish, snack, and clothing sales respectively.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 02 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle veut renforcer son activité de petit commerce de fruits locaux. Elle souhaite assurer à ses enfants une bonne condition de vie, de santé et de scolarisation. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is married and the mother of 6 children with 2 others for whom she is responsible. She wants to bolster her little business selling local fruit. She hopes to ensure good living conditions for her children, as well as health and education. She is intending to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of local fruit, in this season particularly mangoes

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 21 and 11. She has sold khanga (traditional dresses) and charcoal since 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.
 
In the past, Mgeni took out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and khanga for her business.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi M. is a 23-year-old farmer who grows rice, while her husband is a fisherman. Yi is married but has no children. She and her husband live in Kompong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province. To expand her husband's business and increase the family's income, Yi is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase fishing tools, including nets and fishing line. This will increase their income to be able to live sufficiently. Mrs. Yi and his wife are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools including nets and fishing line

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children, between 9 and 6 years old. She has been a cloth seller (khanga and vitenge: decorative cotton cloth garments common in Eastern Africa) since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 165 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now hopes for another loan to buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her business

loans.name: Fatma A Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 29 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 10, 8, 6 and 1. She has been a bites (snacks) and porridge seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaid and Mwajuma, who also have businesses dealing with bites, firewood, potatoes, cassava and juice sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr: Saly D. est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle veut augmenter le capital de la restauration dont elle s’occupe. Elle prépare et vend de petits mets comme petit déjeuner sur une petite table pour assurer à ses enfants une bonne condition de vie, de santé et de scolarisation. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Saly D. is married and the mother of 5 children. She would like to add to the working capital for her catering business. She prepares various dishes for breakfast and sells them on a little table. Her business helps her ensure good living conditions, health and education for her children. She is intending to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of breakfast

loans.name: Laal

texts.en:
This is a married man, Laal A.; he is 24 and the father of two children, in the Shewa district. There are 6 members including his parents in his family. His father is about 60 and retired, and his older son is 6 years old and studying in his first year in a public school in his village.

When Laal A. got married he was about 14, and he was studying in the 8th grade. His father was working as a headmaster in a public school, but after two years his father has retired and became so weak. So Laal A. left his studying and started a business with 35,000 Afghanis of his own capital. 

First he made a small retail shop in his village. For a few months he encountered a lot of financial difficulties because he didn't have enough goods in his shop, so he couldn't find costumers. But after a short time he started farming beside his shop, and he was able to solve the problems little bit. 

Laal A. has kept this business for 6 years, but last month he changed his business and made a mobile phone shop instead of retail shop. Because he saved some money during the last 6 years of shopkeeping, he made some new shelves in his shop and has spent $240 in its decoration. Just $200 remained of the capital in his hands, so he purchased some mobile phones with that. But he wants to buy more mobiles and phone cards to increase his costumers, so he has requested a loan. 

Laal A. dreams someday that he'll stand on his own feet and restart his remaining education once again. Also, he shows his appreciation to the lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and cards for his shop

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. is a 31-year-old farmer. She earns about $1.00 a day selling grilled potatoes in her village. Her husband, Mr. Nem Theam, is a wood-sawing shop worker. He earns approximately $1.25 per day. Mom has a child, who is a student, and they live in Koktlok Le Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Mom requests a loan of $625 to purchase a pump machine, and the rest of the money will go to purchase fertilizers to help increase the rice yield of their farming business. They hope this loan will increase their income and sustain their family's living.

loans.use: To purchase a pump-machine and fertilizer to increase the rice yield of the farming business

loans.name: Abdul

texts.id: Abdul Wahab sedang melakukan usahanya di teras depan rumah kontrakkannya. Sampai saat ini dia masih menekuni bidang usaha ini. Dia menekuninya bersama dengan isterinya, Suudiyah. Mereka  mengerjakannya setiap hari. Krupuk – krupuk yang belum digoreng masih dalam keadaan kering dan akan awet sampai saat mereka di goreng. Setelah krupuk – krupuk tersebut sudah digoreng, maka mereka harus segera dikonsumsi atau dibungkus dengan rapat sehingga sampai pada saat akan dikonsumsi mereka akan tetap terasa renyah. Setelah semua krupuk digoreng, maka Abdul akan membawanya ke warung – warung atau ke toko – toko dengan mengendarai sepeda motor miliknya. Usaha ini memberikan keuntungan sampai dengan Rp 1,500,000.00 per bulannya. Abdul dan isterinya dikaruniai 2 orang anak, masing – masing berumur 9 tahun (Eka) dan 4 tahun (Emilda). Pinjaman terakhirnya adalah Rp 4,500,000.00. Saat ini dia mengajukan pinjaman sebesar Rp 7,000,000.00 dan merupakan kali yang keempat dia mengajukan pinjaman ke DINARI dan kali yang pertama ke KIVA. Dia ingin dengan pinjaman tersebut dia dapat lebih meningkatkan  keuntungan usahanya.
texts.en:
Abdul W.'s run his business from his home, and his wife Suudiyah helps him out. Everyday they prepare the chips, fries them, and packs them nicely for distribution. Abdul will then sells the chips to the stalls or shops on his motorcycle. He earns about Rp 1,500,000.00 per month. He has two children Eka age 9 and Emilda age 4. His last loan was Rp 4,500,000.00, this time he wish to borrow Rp 7,000,000.00 and is his 4th time borrowing from DINARI and first time from KIVA. He wish to use this financial assistance, to expand his business and increase his profits.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: beli krupuk mentah, beli minyak goreng, beli bensin.

loans.name: Emina

texts.en: Emina lives in the town Doboj with her parents. She is not married. Emina works as a TV presenter on a local TV station, and her monthly salary is 600 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of 1200 KM, and she intends to use it to purchase some new accessories for a coffee shop. She is partnering with another girl. Emina wants to improve her offer in order to attract new customers and improve her profit.

loans.use: To buy new accessories

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en: Sanela is a student, and she lives with her parents. She doesn't work for now, and she decided to ask for this loan in the amount of 1200 KM because she wants to buy seeds for sowing in the greenhouse. After they grow, she will sell them to earn money for school. She wants to ensure that she has enough money to finish her studies and to find a job so that she can help her parents with her salary.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina A. sells cosmetics such as perfume, creams, etc. Philomina has received primary education.  She is divorced and has 6 children. Philomina has been selling cosmetics since 2001. She is responsible for paying the school fees to educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Thioya

texts.fr: Thioya S. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants avec 05 autres en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt qui lui permettra de préparer et de vendre du lait caillé et en même temps du thiackry (met préparé à base de lait caillé et de semoule). Elle pourrait ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et plus particulièrement des enfants. <b>voici son premier prêt qu’elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Thioya S., 51, is married and the mother of 2 children with 5 others for whom she is responsible. She is hoping for a loan that will allow her to prepare and sell sour milk and at the same time "thiackry" (a dish prepared with sour milk and cream of millet). This will permit her to improve living conditions for her family, most especially for the children. This is her first loan and she will reimburse it at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of sour milk

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby G. est une veuve de 55 ans, mère de 08 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce en détail de divers produits alimentaires locaux. Elle achète ces produits en gros et les revend en détail sur petit étal et ceci lui permettra de bien améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarisation de ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Aby G. is a widow of 55, the mother of 8 children, but she is also raising two others besides her own. She would like to expand her little grocery store where she retails various local foodstuffs. She buys her goods wholesale and re-sells them retail on a small scale. This loan will permit her to greatly improve living conditions and the schooling of her children. She is going to reimburse this loan at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of various local foodstuffs

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady P. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 01 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de fruits saisonnier locaux. Activité qu’elle a déjà menée et dont elle a une bonne expérience. En ce moment, elle a investit son prêt dans la vente  en gros de pastèques et de mangues. Cette activité lui permettra d’assurer à ses enfants une bonne condition de vie, de santé et de scolarisation. <b>Elle va rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Khady P. is married and the mother of 6 children with one other for whom she is responsible. She would like to bolster her business selling seasonal local fruit. She has already been in this business and has a good deal of experience in the field. At this point in time, she wants to invest her loan in selling watermelons and mangoes wholesale. This business will permit her to ensure good living conditions, health and education for her children. She is going to reimburse the loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of local fruit

loans.name: Wahida's Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Wahida is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 5 months and 14 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Wahida is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales, bites sales, fish and juice sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Zawadi's Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Zawadi is divorced with 2 children aged 5 and 1. She is a fish and bites seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Zawadi now seeks a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with bites sales, juice sales, firewood sales, bread sales, eggs and fish sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ashura's Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 39 years old. She is married with 10 children between the ages of 20 and 1. She runs her own shop, where she has sold fish since 1998. Every day, she works from 6 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.
 
Ashura has already taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy more items and fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with owning a shop, and selling clothes and other items.

loans.use: To buy more items and fish for her business.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 48 years old. She is a widow with one child aged 20 years old. She has been a clothes and bites seller since 1988. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

In the past, Pili has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Pili is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Alawia

texts.en:
Alawia is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 6, 4, and 7 months. She has sold juice since 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
 
Alawia is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mwatum

texts.en:
Mwatum is 28 years old. She is divorced with one child aged 3 years old. She has been running her own phone accessories shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 110 from her sales.

Mwatum is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maisha

texts.en:
Maisha is 45 years old. She is married with one child aged 18 years old. She has been a firewood and flour seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Maisha now seeks for a loan to buy more firewood and flour for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and flour for her business

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El CME La Esperanza se encuentra en el Barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15Km de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo del programa con una calificación excelente, de las 15 mujeres quienes integran el grupo 12 de ellas están accediendo ya a un crédito de Gs. 1.000.000.

Estas señoras son amas de casa y llevan además adelante sus microempresas para poder generara mayores ingresos a sus familias. Bernardina es vendedora ambulante, ella vende distintos tipos de mercaderías especialmente ropas y cosas para el hogar; Zully vende frutas y verduras y Sandra O. y Eva S. son empleadas domésticas que tienen pensado dedicarse en paralelo a sus actividades a la venta.

Olga A. es costurera y realiza distintos tipos de vestidos y uniformes para oficinas; Rogelia vende queso, huevos y harina de maíz. Sixta vende deliciosas comidas rápidas que ella misma prepara mientras que Marcelina es una excelente peluquera.

Mirtha E. vende productos de limpieza que ella misma elabora, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos de barrio; Numidia R. posee una despensa que ella misma administra al igual que Gladys C. y Ángela E.. Por último tenemos a las señoras Ceferina que tiene un bello kiosco, Norma B. que tiene una panadería y Juana R. que se dedica a la venta de helados y comidas rápidas.

Todas estas mujeres agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que les da para aumentar su capital de trabajo, mejorando sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus respectivas familias.
texts.en:
The CME, La Esperanza, is located in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Yaguaron, 15km from the city of Paraguari. It is currently in the fifth cycle of the program and is highly qualified. Of the 15 women who make up the group, 12 are already receiving a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Gs.

These women are housewives but also run their microbusinesses in order to generate more income for their families. Bernardina is a traveling saleswoman, selling different types of merchandise, particularly clothes and household items. Zully sells fruits and vegetables, and Sandra O. and Eva S. are domestic employees who are planning to also become saleswomen.

Olga A. is a seamstress, making different kinds of dresses and office uniforms. Rogelia sells cheese, eggs and corn flour. Sixta sells delicious fast food that she makes herself, while Marcelina is an excellent hairdresser.

Mirtha E. sells cleaning products that she makes herself. Her main customers are neighbors from her neighborhood. Numidia R., Gladys Chavez and Angela E. all sell food. Finally, Ceferina has a lovely kiosk, Norma Benitez has a bakery, and Juana R. sells ice cream and fast food.

All of these women want to thank the Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity it gives them to increase their capital, their income, and finally to improve the quality of life for their families.


Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, drinks, baked goods, cooking oil, pasta, rice, flour, dairy products, fruits and vegetables in general, yeast, chemicals to make cleaning products, ingredients for making ice cream, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Faida's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Faida is 31 years old. She is married with 6 children between 14 and 7 years old. She has been a firewood and bites seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

Faida now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with chicken sales, charcoal sales, firewood sales, and bread sales.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Rehema's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 11, 8, 6, and 1. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and soup seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, firewood sales, tailoring, painting, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, de ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por la oportunidad que se les está ofreciendo ya que ninguna otra institución lo ha hecho.

Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres con distintas actividades que le generan ingresos para sus familias. Gilda P. es modista y posee muchas clientas que van a su casa solicitando la confección de vestidos y uniformes para sus oficinas; las señoras Isabel, Francisca, Bernardita, Leoncia y Edith poseen cantinas en distintas escuelas y colegios en donde venden principalmente comidas rápidas, golosinas y gaseosas.

Basílica S. y Graciela O. poseen una despensa cada una, en donde comercializan todo tipo de mercaderías. Reina Q. Amalia Saldívar y Patricia V. se dedican a la venta de distintos tipos de frutas y verduras. Florentina es artesana y se dedica a la costura de telas típicas de nuestro país.

Emilce Gonzáles y Amelia F. tiene un kiosco, Felicita C. es vendedora ambulante de diversos tipos de mercaderías. Gilda Martínez es empleada doméstica y está deseosa de poder comprar mercaderías varias para vender y así incrementar sus ingresos. Por último tenemos a Cándida V. que se dedica a la venta de una de las comidas típicas más consumidas en nuestro país y que se llama Chipa.

El comité lleva por nombre Renacer, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, con calificación excelente, integrada por 17 emprendedoras y activas mujeres.
texts.en:
15 km from the Office of Paraguiri, in the city of Yaguarón, a group of women who wanted to start businesses joined together so that they could increase their working capital, and thus improve their quality of life and that of their families. The women contacted Fundación Paraguaya in order to learn about its program, and when Fundación Paraguaya offered them an opportunity they accepted it, since no other institution had already made them an offer. The group is made up of women who work in different productive activities that allow them to generate income for their families. Gilda P. is a dressmaker and has many customers who go to her house to order suits and uniforms for their jobs. Isabel, Francisca, Bernadita, Leoncia, and Edith run refectories in different schools, where they mainly sell fast food, candy, and soft drinks. Basílica S. and Graciela O. each have a grocery store where they sell all kinds of merchandise. Reina Q., Amalia Saldívar and Patricia V. make a living selling various fruits and vegetables. Florentina is a craftswoman and makes a living weaving traditional Paraguayan fabrics. Emilce Gonzáles and Amelia F. have a kiosk, while Felicita C. is a street vendor who sells a variety of merchandise. Gilda Martínez works as a domestic servant and wants to buy a variety of merchandise so she can sell it and thus increase her income. Finally, we have Cándida V., who makes a living selling Chipa, which is one of the most popular traditional foods in Paraguay. The name of this group is Renacer, and it is made up of 17 active and enterprising women. They are currently in their fourth loan cycle and have an excellent rating.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Your loans will be invested in each of their respective activities, such as purchasing fabric, candy, cornstarch, lard, meat, beverages, baked goods, oil, noodles, sugar, rice, flour, dairy products, various fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos R. es de Cruce Liberación-Choré, una ciudad vecina de Santaní; el posee casa propia y es casado, con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Carlos es propietario de un taller mecánico de motocicletas y motosierras en general, con 22 años de funcionamiento. Cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias para realizar su trabajo, también realiza pintura de motocicletas.

Es un señor muy conocido de la zona, tiene clientela formada, y sus trabajos poseen garantía. Sus hijos lo ayudan en el taller y en la foto aparece el con uno de ellos.

Ahora quiere poner un negocio de ventas de repuestos para motos y motosierras, y así aumentar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carlos R. is from Cruce Liberación-Choré, a city near Santaní. He owns his own house and is married with 6 adult children. Carlos has a repair shop that generally fixes motorcycles and chainsaws, and has been in business for 22 years. He has all of the tools necessary for completing his work, which also includes painting motorcycles. Carlos is well known in the area, has an established clientele, and always guarantees his work. His children help him in his shop; one of his sons appears with him in the photo. Now Carlos would like to set up a business selling spare parts for motorcycles and chainsaws, which would help him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for motorcycles and chainsaws

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es:
La señora Eloina es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, con 3 hijos, y se dedica ala venta de frutas y verduras, en el mercado municipal. Trabaja en este ramo desde hace 13 años. Es una señora muy trabajadora, y muy sacrificada, ya que desde tempranas horas de la madrugada ella inicia su jornada para ir a comprar las frutas y verduras frescas para vender.

Gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado que sus hijos estudien, esto representa para ella una alegría muy grande además de ser una inspiración para seguir luchando día a día.

Durante estos años ha sabido ahorrar y tiene como proyecto comprar otro local más amplio en la misma zona, para así poder cargar más mercaderías para la venta.

En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías en cantidad de frutas de estación así como también de verduras
texts.en:
Ms. Eloina is from the city of Santani. She is 62 years old, a widow, and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables at the city's market. She has been in this activity for the last 13 years. She is very hardworking and devoted, as she starts her day very early at dawn by going to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables, to sell later.

This job has allowed her children to study. This is one of her biggest joys in life and an inspiration for her to keep going day after day.

During these years, she has saved money, and plans to buy another store in the area, a larger one, to be able to offer more products for sale.

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.


Translated from Spanish by Gabriela Urricariet, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es:
La señora Marlin L. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Carlos Gustavo Villalba de 32 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos q esta en la edad escolar.

La señora se dedica a la venta ambulante de de ropas y artículos varios para el hogar. Se dedica en esta actividad, desde hace 8 años. Empezó trabajando con otra señora que le proveía de las mercaderías, hasta que tuvo un pequeño capital, y pudo comprar las mercaderías al por mayor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y con una clientela ya formada que le generan buenos ingresos. Para el futuro piensa abrir una tienda de ropas en su propio local.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, camisas, camperas, ropas de invierno y algunas de temporada verano.
texts.en:
Ms. Marlin L. is 27 years old, married to Mr. Carlos Gustavo Villalba -who is 32 years old- and has two school age children.

She is a street vendor who sells clothes and household items. She has been involved in this activity for the last 8 years. She started out working with another woman, who would provide her with the merchandise, until she was able to save up a little money and buy wholesale merchandise.

Thanks to her efforts she is getting ahead, and has several clients that allow her to earn a good income. In the future, she plans to open her own store where she will sell clothes.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as T-shirts, pants, shirts, jackets, winter clothes, and some summer clothes.


Translated from Spanish by Gabriela Urricariet, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Sofia García es de la ciudad de Yasy Kañy, del Barrio Centro, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Ángel Martínez de 59 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad, que trabajan en forma independientes.

Tiene un Comedor de nombre “RAQUELITA”, en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, y le genera buenos ingresos.

Sofía trabaja en este rubro hace ya 10 años, se caracteriza por la buena y fina preparación de sus comidas, muy conocidos en la zona por ser muy ricas

Sofía necesita de un crédito pues quiere construir un salón más amplio en su domicilio para su comedor, ya que tiene muchos clientes y así podrá albergar a mayor cantidad de personas y con mayor comodidad para ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofía G. is from the city of Yasy Kañy, in the Centro neighborhood. She is 56 years old and is married to Mr. Angel Martinez, who is 59. The couple has two adult children who are self-sufficient.

Sofía has a lunch counter called "Raquelita" in her home. She has regular customers and generates good income from this business.

Sofía needs this loan so that she can build a bigger dining room in her house, since she has many clients and this way she will be able to seat more people more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bigger dining room

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank.

Marta is a single mother, is 51 years old and has one son who is 13 years of age. Marta is retired from the education sector. She lives with her mother and son and has a store in the Santa Clara Market for which she pays monthly rent. Marta sells a variety of clothing for women, gentleman, and children, and she acquires her products in Lima, Huancayo and also has suppliers that bring them to her business. With the help of her mother she operates the store, which is open every day of the week.

Marta needs a loan of 1350 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, pants and sweaters.

Marta dreams that her son will continue studying to be a professional, wants to diversity her business more and improve the appearance of her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Marta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Marta es madre soltera, tiene 51 años y 1 hijo de 13 años, Marta es jubilada del sector educación, Marta vive con su mama y su hijo, Marta tiene una tienda en el mercado Santa Clara por cual paga un alquiler mensual, Marta vende ropa variada para mujeres, caballeros, niños, sus productos lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, Huancayo y también tiene proveedores que le llevan a su negocio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, la atención en su tienda son todos los días de la semana.

Marta necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones, chompas.

Marta sueña con que su hijo siga estudiando para ser profesional, surtir más su negocio, mejorar la presentación de su local.

loans.use: Marta needs a loan of 1350 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, pants and sweaters.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is a member of the Bonanza communal bank.

Maura lives with her partner, is 39 years old and has 4 children. She lives in the community of Ceccelambras which is located in the city of Ayacucho. Maura works growing potatoes, whose production is sent to the city of Lima and she also buys potatoes from the producers in her area and, after consolidating them, them to the city of Lima 2 times a week in the production months of February to August. In addition, Maura buys a variety of animals in the area villages in the months of September to January and then sells them in her community’s market.

Maura needs a loan of 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of goat and pig livestock.

Maura dreams of having a car with which she will be able to transport her products and of providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Maura es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Maura vive en la comunidad de Ceccelambras que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Maura se dedica a la agricultura de papa, cuya producción lo envía a la ciudad de Lima y también compra papa de los productores de su zona y luego de acopiar lo manda a la ciudad de Lima 2 veces por semana en los meses de producción de febrero a agosto, además Maura en los meses de septiembre a enero compra animales variados en los pueblos de su zona y luego lo vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de ganado caprino y porcino.

Maura sueña con tener un carro con el cual pueda transportar sus productos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maura needs a loan 3000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of goat and pig livestock.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank.

Yaneth lives with her partner and is 26 years old. Yaneth studied to be a primary level teacher. Yaneth travels to the markets of the region where she buys a variety of cereals, an activity that she carries out on Saturdays and Sundays. Yaneth works as a promotor of the program for children ages 0-5 years old in the district of Socos, where she also buys her cereals. After stocking up on products she sells them wholesale to vendors in the different markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Yenth buys cheeses that she sells in the same way.

Yaneth needs of loan of 1350 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat and barley.

Yaneth dreams of having her own pre-school with all of the services necessary for the children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Yaneth es conviviente y tiene 26 años, Yaneth estudio para ser profesora del nivel primario, Yaneth viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, Yaneth trabaja como promotora de un programa de niños de 0 a 5 años, en el distrito de Socos de donde también compra cereales, luego de acopiar sus productos los vende al por mayor a los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Yenth también compra quesos que vende de la misma modalidad.

Yaneth necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en al compra de maíz, trigo y cebada.

Yaneth sueña con tener su jardín propio que cuente con todos los servicios necesarios para los niños.

loans.use: Yaneth needsa loan of 1350 soles which will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank. Rosa is a single mother, is 26 years old and has one son who is 2 years old. Rosa lives with her mother and son in the Mollepata neighborhood, which is located 20 minutes from the center of the city of Ayacucho and still does not have basic services. Rosa has a variety store in which she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. Rosa goes to the supply market every day where she makes her purchases. She has her mother’s support and the store is open every day of the week from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Rosa needs a loan of 1650 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and drinks.

Rosa dreams of having another piece of land on which to build a house made of sturdy materials, diversifying her business and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 2 años, Rosa vive junto a su mama e hijo en el barrio de Mollepata que se ubica a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, lugar que no cuenta aun con los servicios básicos. Rosa tiene una tienda surtida en donde vende abarrote, verduras, carne, Rosa cada dos días va al mercado de abastos a realizar sus compras, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su mama, la atención en su tienda es todos los días de la semana y de las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, bebidas.

Rosa sueña con tener otro terreno y construir una casa de material noble, surtir su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1650 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and drinks.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa is a member of the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.

Jesusa is 38-years-old and married with 5 children. Jesusa lives in the Morro de Arica district where she owns a small chicken stand. She works at night, when her children are able to assist her. Jesusa began selling French fries with fried chicken at the door of her house, a trade she learned from a nephew who owns a chicken stand in the city of Lima. Additionally, Jesusa travels to fairs where she buys cereals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a car that she uses to transport passengers to the district of Vinchos.

Jesusa needs a loan of $350 (1,000 soles) for investing in the purchase of oil, potatoes, and various sauces.

Jesusa dreams of expanding her business, completing construction of her house, providing her children with everything they need, and having her children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
